34237432.review:
Did you ever dream of becoming a researcher, helping mankind to unveil the mysteries of the universe? Yes? Then close Steam and go study.

Otherwise you might want to play some games, such as Boson X. Whereas the premise about the particle accelerator itself is merely illustrative, the game itself is fun. 

The mechanics are pretty simple: constantly run, jump straight or jump+rotate right/left.  To complete a scenario you must stand on blue platforms which grant you "research points". Nearing 100% research points for one stage will increase the running speed of your Researcher (and thus the difficulty) and reaching 100% research points completes the stage and unlocks further stages. Otherwise, red platforms collapse once you step on them, and blinking platforms are actually moving. Stages are randomly generated, but you can clearly notice the "building blocks" for the randomization.

That's it about the mechanics. It doesn't change much during the game. The increasing difficulty comes from the initial speed of later stages, more complex platform structures, lack of shadows that will twist your depth perception and psychedelic textures that will confuse your naive brain. I didn't find it obscenely difficult, however.

Boson X is pretty inexpensive, has cards and the achievements are natural. The last achievement having 8% completion rate honestly surprised me. It felt more like a 2% achievement. I think I'd add the "casual" tag to this game.

34087338.review: Günstiger kann man einen Sucht-Titel kaum haben. Story gibt es nicht, wir lenken einen von drei Charakteren einer Forschungseinrichtung und betreten achtzehn verschiedene Endless-Runner Level im Rahmen eines Partikelbeschleunigers. Am Ende ist 100% das Ziel, dann ist das neue Elementarteilchen entdeckt und alle sechs Teilchen ist eine der drei Facilities abgeschlossen. Dabei geht es auf acht Ebenen durch einen bunten rasanten Tunnel und nach den 100 % geht es für die High Scores unendlich weiter - eben bis wir abstürzen. Bockschwer und absolut motivierend!

[i]Boson X[/i] est un die & retry très réussi pour son prix, vous en aurez vraiment pour votre prix si en plus vous le prenez en soldes.

33252128.review:
A game consisting of your character running through an endless cycle of varying obstacles for 18 levels, trying to obtain as much blue energy as possible. It requires a lot of practise and persistance to complete in full whilst also relying heavily on it's simplistic concept. The game can grow tiresome after a while but is specifically targetted for people who like a challenge and someone who isn't easily frustrated. The game features enough to entertain the average player for a couple of hours. Definitely consider buying the game when it comes on sale, it's nothing special but easily worth the little money it asks for. 

Pros (+)

- Each level progressively gets harder and is accustomed to the player improving as they go through.
- The 18 levels took over 11 hours for me to gain a 100% pass rate.
- Replay factor for beating friend's scores on the leaderboard and gaining a better worldwide ranking. 


Cons (-)

- Limited soundtrack that is reused for more than one level, the tracks aren't too great and quite repetitive.
- The graphics are very minimal and could easily pass for an online flash game.

33153343.review:
Я не знаю, что написать поэтому напишу рецепт Бисквитного рулета.
Чтобы приготовить бисквитный рулет, вам потребуются следующие ингредиенты:
*****************************************************************************************
2 ст. пшеничной муки
1 ст. сахара
400 г свежей или замороженной малины
8 яичных желтков
4 яичных белка
8 ст. л. сахарной пудры
1 ст. л. картофельного крахмала
500 мл 33%-ных сливок.
_____________________________________________________________________________
Как готовится бисквитный рулет «Сладкая малинка»:

1. Яичные желтки и половину сахара поместить в миску, вилкой растереть до появления белой пены. Белки взбить в миксере в пену, постепенно прибавить к ним вторую половину сахара, продолжая взбивать. В результате должна получиться устойчивая белая масса, которую следует аккуратно вылить в желтки, перемешивая ложкой сверху вниз. Муку смешать с крахмалом, просеять в яичную смесь, перемешивать тесто от краёв к центру, пока не разойдутся все комочки. Вылить тесто на противень, застеленный пергаментом и в течение 8-10 минут испечь корж при среднем жаре (170-180 градусов). 
2. Готовый корж снять с противня вместе с пергаментом, перевернуть его на чистый лист бумаги, посыпанный сахаром или сахарной пудрой, бумагу, на которой он выпекался, снять. Накрыть бисквит сбрызнутой водой салфеткой и дать ему остыть.
3. Малину промыть (ели Вы используете замороженные ягоды – разморозить), положить ягоды в дуршлаг и подождать, пока с них стечёт лишняя жидкость. Немного ягод отложить в отдельную посуду, остальные размять вилкой. Сливки взбить в пену с сахарной пудрой, выложить их в малину, перемешать. 
4. Бисквит смазать ровным слоем начинки, свернуть рулетом и поместить швом вниз на поднос или блюдо. Посыпать изделие сахарной пудрой и украсить ягодами. Пред употреблением рулет лучше на 1-2 часа отправить в холодильник.

32238963.review:
Boson X is a fun runner game where the goal is to get a high score. The goal of each level is to survive and run on blue panels which fill up a meter when you're running over them. The game gets faster and faster as the meter fills up, and when it gets to 100% you win! The visuals of the stage get changed and you can keep playing for extra points.

The best feature of this game is that the leaderboards are quick and show up whenever you die, so it's easy to see where you have placed. The game also has a lot of replayability - there are 18 levels for you to play, and while some stand out more than others, all of them feel unique, which is fairly impressive. The presentation is simplistic but I find that it works for the most part. The soundtrack is a little forgettable, though, but it fits when you're playing.

A few nitpicks I have is the transition from when you get 100% is a little too fast for me so I usually ended up dying instantly as soon as I reached it - I imagine this is something you can get used to but it's still worth noting. The grunting noises of the characters can also get fairly annoying but thankfully you can choose to turn off the sound effects if it you feel it's too bad.

Overall I can definitely recommend this game at the asking price. It has quite a lot of content and the core gameplay is very fun!

31258281.review: As a skinny white guy who complains about thing on the internet, I probably don't really strike you as an avid sports fan. There is no reason that I should not enjoy the Olympics. It combines sport, something I take mild interest in, and competition betwixt nations, which infatuated me inexplicably when I was younger. But the reason I dislike the Olympics is what you're seeing on the screen right now, or rather the fact that no-one actually cares about what you're seeing on screen right now. You're probably thinking to yourself, "what are you talking about? Of course people care about the results of the Olympics Thomas." But the truth of the matter is what people really care about is the results of the individual events. I guess that's fin if you're a big sports fan, or if you're related to one of the athletes, but the fact that these results don't culminate into something, and that there's no overall winner of the Olympics drives me up the wall. Allow me to explain. Of course the Olympics does have a winner, the person who wins the most medals. But who on earth cares in the end? The winning country doesn't get some special award in the closing ceremony. People don't talk about them in social events. Not to mention, countries with higher populations have an insane advantage. As a result, the Olympics is only a competition between athletes, and not countries. And that's where the olympics loses me. I don't wanna watch Sanne Verhagen vs Hortance Diedhiou, I wanna watch the Netherlands vs Senegal. I don't wanna watch Morad Zemouri vs Dirk Van Tichelt, I wanna watch Qatar vs Belgium. I don't wanna watch Victor Scvortov vs Zeyad Mater, I wanna watch the United Arab Emirates vs Yemen. You get the idea. With sporting events like the world cup where it's one sport, keeping up with the athletes is easy enough. I overhear people discussing the performance of certain players all the time. But come Olympic time, nobody I listen to is raving about the performances of a certain athlete. Ask anyone who won a certain event, they aren't gonna say Frank Stevens, or Jeff Smith. Or however you pronounce this. They're gonna say countries like USA, or China, or UK, or Central African Republic, I.E. The thing the Olympics wants you to think is less important than the athletes.So if I'm just following individual athletes, and not how a certain country or countries are doing, then I don not care. Am I supposed to just pick a favourite? I was watching women's gymnastics the other day for... reasons... and I guess I'm supporting Switzerland. Not because I have Swiss blood or Swiss pride  or I feel that they are gonna necessarily win. Instead because Giulia Steingruber is attractive. Ok, I don't hate the Olympics. Most of the time sports are boring to watch (Excluding the aforementioned), and I guess if you're really patriotic, you'll watch events to support your country, and see the successes of your fellow man. But I'm not a patriotic person. And when choosing who to support comes down to drawing a random card from the pile, it's no longer a game of earning supporters. It's a game of Mario Party.

Fantastic, at times infuriating and in the end very satisfying.
The procedurally generated levels make this game more a process of learning the logic and patterns of each level rather than the exact keypresses necessary to beat a level. Overall perhaps my favorite "small" game ever, and definitely the best running game I know of.
5/5

30000310.review:
Gameplay: This game is a series of Dark Souls bosses. I seriously found myself having the same exact approach to each level as I would a boss. I’d start up a level and fail usually straight away. Often the level would seem impossible or unfair at first. I’d feel like giving up and often I did. But upon returning and attempting the levels more, I found myself slowly inching that energy bar up towards 100%. Essentially I was learning the levels move-set and its new tricks. Each level completion was such a release of tension and a sense of victory and accomplishment, that I failed immediately afterward, unable to rack up any bonus points. This game is a platformer, where you run through a hexagonal world of ever changing platforms. The game has 18 levels in which I spent over 10 hours. The levels obviously ramp up in difficulty, adding in new mechanics here and there to keep the player on their toes. The goal is to get your energy level to 100% and is achieved by running on the scarce blue platforms.

Design: The level design is randomly generated from a base set of platforming segments that all flow together nicely (when you do figure it out). This is important as each level segment has to flow into every other segment. You wouldn’t want a game to have these randomly generated combinations to run you into an impossible scenario, making the game unfair sometimes. The visuals are blocky and basic, but serve their function. The sound design is overall decent. The music can be a bit annoying at times and I found it’s not really any help (or hindrance) to listen or not. One level in particular, I finally beat when I muted the audio. But this could be due to the increasing pitch that is triggered as you ramp the energy up. That sound mechanic really adds tension to those final percentage points.

Overall: I’d recommend this game to anyone wanting a platforming/runner challenge.

29039389.review:
Boson X est comme un Super Hexagon auquel on aurait rajouter de la 3D. De ce simple fait, le jeu reprend tous les travers de son prédécesseur pour en rajouter un autre, bien à lui. Dans Super Hexagon, la génération procédurale faisait apparaître des situations dans lesquelles il était impossible d'éviter un obstacle car l'anticipation ne suffisait pas : il fallait être doué du don de prescience. Dans Boson X, c'est la même chose sauf que l'angle de la caméra, située dans le dos du personnage et non plus au-dessus de lui et de l'environnement, rend chaotique la gestion de la profondeur de champ. Non content de ne pas pouvoir anticiper les obstacles générés aléatoirement juste devant vous (bien que parfois, ils apparaissent juste à temps pour vous laisser l'occasion de comprendre qu'il n'y a aucun chemin viable possible depuis votre position), il faudra aussi deviner à quelle distance sont situés ceux que vous parviendrez à repérer à temps en dépit de la déformation des distances produite par l'angle de la caméra qui aurait gagner à prendre un peu plus de hauteur.
Mais il y a pire : là où Super Hexagon vous autorisait, malgré toutes les situations inextricables qui pouvaient survenir, une certaine liberté de mouvement vous assurant une chance de réussite, Boson X repose sur un gameplay extrêmement rigide où chaque saut se fait directement le long d'une ligne dont on ne peut plus dévier une fois lancé. À celà s'ajoute une gestion de l'inertie contre-intuitive puisque relâcher la touche de saut ne vous fait pas immédiatement redescendre (contrairement à la plupart des jeux du genre) mais poursuivre votre parcours dans les air en fonction de votre vitesse (or celle-ci change en permanence selon votre "niveau de charge" qui augmente chaque fois que vous courrez sur une plate-forme bleue).
Enfin, et contrairement à Super Hexagon, la musique est lente voire lancinante et ne contribue donc pas à créer un rythme qui pourrait, éventuellement, aider le joueur à s'approprier le niveau. Ainsi on obtient la recette suivante : génération procédurale + inertie mal gérée + profondeur de champ déformée + musique sans réel rythme = un jeu frustrant qui n'accorde aucune gratification ni aucune vraie possibilité d'amélioration par l'apprentissage (et l'usage de la manette n'y change rien alors qu'elle améliore vraiment la jouabilité dans Super Hexagon). Mieux vaut donc éviter Boson X au profit de Super Hexagon ou, mieux encore, de Geometry Dash qui reste, à mon sens, le meilleur runner game qui soit.

27881951.review:
What is Boson X? It's an infinite runner.

In every level there are floating platforms thrown around everywhere and you have to keep pushing forward and do your best not to fall down cause if you do it's game over. Your goal in each level is to find short strips of ground covered in glowing color (pardon my lack of scientific language but it probably has something to do with particles or some other obscure science stuff my simple mind can't comprehend) and run through them. The longer you run through those glowing stripes the more percentage is added to your actual score.

In order to finish a level you have to reach the limit set by the developers. Once you do you can still keep going (a lot faster than before, mind you) but the level is complete and you get the achievement (there are 18 achievements, each for completing each level) and you unlock new levels.

That's it. You have to do that in each level in order to beat the game. There's no plot, graphics are not amazing (good for its purpose though) and the game is very simple in its premise. Don't be fooled though, it's without question one of the hardest games available on Steam. If you like runners and challenges make sure to play this one as it's addictive as hell plus very rewarding, satisfaction you get from completing each level can't be compared to anything else.

Pros:

+ Fast paced
+ Good music and nice visuals
+ Very challenging and rewarding
+ "One more time, I swear" type of addiction

Cons:

- After you're done you wish it had twice as many levels
- Not easy on the eyes if you play it for long (especially the last level)

Rating: 9/10

27620152.review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 10.7h  (based on steam).
[b]Grindy Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Difficult Achievement:[/b] Yes (5 achievements; can be more or less based on your skill).
[b]Developer Response:[/b] No (last response is in 25 Apr 2016).

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Boson X is a quick fast paced runner game where you have to dodge obstacles and step on blue colored platform to collect some sort of percentage. The game will finish after you earn 100%, although you can still continue after that to aim for high score in an altered colored mode. There is also a high score list which is sorted by the said percentage.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
This game is using 2D models on 3D environment and the characters are soft colored. I really like the character design and animation when they are running through the stages. The UI is also simple and easy to understand.

[h1]Music[/h1]
There are roughly 6 bgms in total which is played in each area. Each bgm has their own different characteristic and I really like the music except for the Graviton and Dark X Boson stage. The first one sounds like you're in temple and the second one is way too quiet.

[h1]The game[/h1]
This game is easy to learn but hard to master. You just have to jump through obstacles and (or) move left and right to dodge them. At some point, there will be a blue platform which will help you obtain some percentage. You'll finish the stage after you obtain 100%, although you still can continue the game to aim for high score in an altered color afterwards which might hurt your eyes. The more percentage you have, the faster your character will run.

There are 3 different areas which consists of 6 stages. Each area has its own unique mechanics which is slightly different from each other. The first few stages will serve as a tutorial (yet still difficult for beginners) to introduce new general mechanics and some stages and area will be unlocked after you complete a particular stage.

There are also 3 different characters to use although i doubt that there will be any difference except for their sfx when they are running. I have gotten used to the first female character which makes me can't focus when i switch it to the robot character.

Each stage took less than 10 minutes to beat. However, you'll spend more time to beat it because you have to remember and practice for each patterns in every stage. In the last level of each area, the view will be slightly altered which can hurt your eyes (especially the last stage in the last area, Dark X Boson).

When you died (and fail to complete the stage), there will be a graph which shows your progress in the last few runs. I really like the design because i can see how far i'm improved.

I don't know the reason why, but you can't pause mid game. If you have to do an important stuff when you're aiming for high score, you're doomed. There is also no restart button in case you messed up. However, this won't really matter because you can kill yourself easily.

Pros:
- 18 stages
- 3 different characters
- Challenging stages
- High scores

Cons:
- Some level hurts your eyes
- Can't pause mid game
- No restart button

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This is a fast paced runner game which focused on eye hand coordination. There are 18 different stages with 3 different playable characters. You can only win the stage either by skill or luck.

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]Especially if you like games like this. If you don't like games that hurts your eyes or difficult games which require skill to beat, skip this.[/i]

27227052.review:
Quite possibly the most addicting game I have in my Library.

What makes Boson X so great? Its simple formula. You jump from one platform to the next, trying to land on the blue ones to fill up an energy bar. When the energy bar gets to 100%, you have completed the level. But you can keep playing to try and increase your score even further.

Sounds simple? It is! Only it gets harder as you go. Much harder. First, the levels keep speeding up as your score gets higher, which makes an already hectic game even more hectic. Levels also get harder, much harder. The difficulty jump between the first and the last level in the game is astronomically high. Soon you will deal with more hazards. Platforms that drop once you step on them, platforms that come at you with speed and lightning bolts of DEATH are just a few examples of what you will have to deal with.

Some levels are just pure evil! Platforms coming at different angles, entire levels spinning around and jumps that at first seem impossible to make. Boson X is a really fun ride from the very beginning to the very end. While we are on the subject, let's talk about replay value.

I have completed this game in about 7 hours. And as of writing this review, I have 71 hours on record and I expect that Boson X will soon join the "Over 100 hours" Club. Why? Two words. Steam Leaderboards. This is the prime reason why I bought Boson X. I'm not a very competitive person by nature and most of the games I play are single player. But Boson X is an exception. The fact that I have a leaderboard where I can check my scores against other players provides a constant challenge for me. And it fuels the addicting part of the game. I want to go as high as I can on leaderboards. Even thought I have replayed a level close to 1k times, I still want to improve myself.

That is incredibly fun. Having a lot of bad runs and then having one great run that pushes you up the leaderboard gives you a big a sense of accomplishment. And then you want more, more, more, MORE! :)

The graphics are very simple, but they just work. Some levels look amazing, almost like you are in a different world.

The sound design is just right. The sound when you run on the blue platform and your score increases is the best sound in the world.

The music is simple. Each level has two loops that last about 15 seconds each. But the music works so well and is so charming that I didn't even notice how short the loops are. They just fit the game and what's going on the screen.

I only have one minor complaint and that is that I sometimes get random FPS lag where my FPS drops from otherwise rock solid 60 FPS to around 40 FPS. The FPS lag usually clears up quickly if it starts in the middle of the run. And if the lag starts at the beginning of the run, I simply restart the level. I don't think that's the game, I think that's my machine and OpenGL being a bit funky. But It's nothing major. Otherwise, the game is polished and has no bugs.

Still not sure if you want this game or not? Try the free version then! Boson X started as a free game, which later released on Steam with more content and Steam Leaderboards. So if you like the free version, get this one to support the amazing devs and get 12 more levels and 2 more playable characters. The price is fair compared to how many potential hours of fun you can get out of the game.

PS: This game is hard by the way. Super hard. It's one of those games that you are going to pull out your hair while playing. If that sounds fun to you, get the game. You won't regret it.

26737490.review:
的确，很难想象这个原价15，打折3块的12m游戏能做出如此好的效果。
玩法很简单，就只用到上下左右四个按键。ws都是直线跳，ad是往左右移动一格，长按会有更长的滞空效果。
红色的板子是坏的，你跳到红色板子他会下陷，白色和灰色的板子是可以让你一直奔跑，最后蓝色的板子是让你加速。
这个游戏通关的指标就是在蓝色的板子叠加速度到100%，游戏右上方可以显示当前速度。
关卡方面，画面前方会有不断旋转的道具最终会形成一个六边形的道具供你选择跳跃。
背板是有用的，因为只有游戏只有12m。每个关卡都会有几个模式的板子以不断随机的方式不断组成。
但是背板不是绝对的，这也是我写这篇评测的原因。
每个关卡都会有不同的方式来让你感受这个游戏的恶意，可能是在一个暗色的背景，连续多个红色板子不断闪烁让你视觉疲劳。
也可能是前方旋转很多不必要的道具来迷惑你选择的下一格。
挂卡2小时，玩了1个多小时，有45分钟是卡在第四关。没错就是商店页面视频第一个关卡。
它其实不难，可是他蓝色的加速板子出现率非常低，让你不断在重复的三四个模式的板子里重复，简直精神折磨。
最后我带上手机耳机听着一首4分多钟的歌终于通关。性子急的建议心情好再玩第四关。

PS:通关是以加速100%为标准，但是可以在一瞬间的赛亚人变身状态无限继续加速下去。随着速度提高，难度也越来越高。所以这是个很耐玩的游戏，不存在通关即可弃的情况。[spoiler]除非你想爱惜你的生命不再自虐。[/spoiler]

Bueno, luego de cumplir 3 horas en tiempo de juego me decidi a realizar el analisis respectivo del videojuego, en este analisis voy a colocar tanto las cosas positivas del videojuego como las negativas, espero que antes de que compren el videojuego lean el comentario para que tengan una idea de como es el videojuego.

Analisis

Positivos:

- Es entretenido, se puede jugar para entretenerse y pasar como unos 20 minutos tratando de pasar un nivel. El juego parece que cuando uno llega al 100% en completar las misiones, salta a otra mision pero se le sigue sumando al porcentaje de la primera misiòn, osea que puedes llegar al 150% o al 200% y, de verdad, se vuelve muy competetivo.

- Tiene 3 personajes las cuales encajan bien en el videojuego, los personajes no tienen cosas distintas, todos son iguales, saltan igual, corren igual, en realidad es algo como para cambiar el aspecto del videojuego, asi de sencillo.

- Tiene cromos y logros, aunque, de verdad que los logros le falto mucho.

Negativos:

- Parece ser que el videojuego salta de lo entretenido  a lo aburrido, el videojuego tiene pocas horas de entretenimiento, los logros y cromos que tiene deberian darle al jugador esa meta de completarselos todos, sin embargo los logros son muy faciles, muy inutil eso.

- Le falta creatividad, se puede hacer un Bosson X mas creativo, mas entretenido, mucho mas amplio y colocarle mejores cosas, no quiero ser un comprador radical de esos que se la pasan diciendo "No el videojuego es bueno unicamente porque yo lo compre" como para sentirme feliz de haber comprado el juego, pero yo se que es malo, (Ojo, este videojuego no es malo) lo unico que quiero dejar con esto es que le falto creatividad.

- Corto, para valer 3 dolares es algo muy corto.

- La musica de que tiene en vez de darle una emociòn al videojuego, lo que hace es como aburrirlo mas, tiene un caracter cientifico, lo se, pero no por eso tiene que tener musica aburrida

Conclusion:

No se decepcionen con este comentario, yo recomendaria comprar el videojuego en las rebajas, de esas que se hacen siempre, ah si, y quiero preguntar una cosa ¿Este juego esta inspirado en Half life? porque no se, pero tiene algo parecido al Half life, no se lo que es, ¿Seran los personajes? Umm, bueno viene mi nota, tiene un 6 de 10, deberian sacar un voton de variados, pero le tendre que poner un positivo.

26080334.review:
This game belongs in the [b]thumbs-sideways[/b] category. I like almost everything about this game, the graphics, the music, the pace, the whole atmosphere-vibe to it..
But.. (you knew this was coming..) the difficulty? [b]NO[/b].
I've long to see an endless runner game where you can beat it relying only on your reflexes and not on your memory of every single pattern of every level. Because that's what you have to do here. The way it works, in the later levels, it is impossible to see ahead far enough so as to plan your steps. There are alternating and repeated patches of patterns, as in most such games, and if you don't instantly recognise the pattern, you will fail. Reflexes are needed very much too but they won't save you.
So if you like such games where you try and try again until you memorise the whole level-pattern, then this is for you. [b]Everything else about it is really well done and the gameplay is very smooth.[/b]
But not for me, so I will leave this as a non-recommendation so that others know what the main issue is.

25348768.review:
Simple mais efficace, Boson X est un jeu de 'jump/running' des plus prenant, le principe est de sauter sur des plateformes avançant vers vous à la façon SuperHexagon pour avancer dans un 'accélérateur de particule' et donc vous avez été envoyé à l'intérieur pour récupérer des fragments de matières inconnues pour arriver au fameux Boson X (Boson de High), pour corser un peu l'ambiance de nombreux pièges tels que des plateformes qui s'éffondrent lorsque l'on saute dessus ou encore des barrières électriques viennent vous faire obstacle et peuvent même vous faire recommencer le niveau si vous ne l'est prenez pas assez en compte.

Les niveaux sont classés en 3 catégories correspondant à 3 centres de recherches : classique(facile) ; dark (moyen) et anti (difficile). Chacun avec ses propres complexités dont je vous laisse découvrir par vous même.

Les musiques se fondent très bien dans l'univers du jeu et sont variables selon les niveaux, en parlant de niveau, ceux si sont formés de schémas bien distinc qui s'ils sont correctement mémorisé vous aideront à améliorer votre niveau. Bien sûr même s'il y a des schémas ceci appraissent de façon aléatoire quand même...

Référence tout à fait assumée au boson de Brout-Englert-Higgs et à la non moins redoutable et insondable mécanique quantique.
Dans la peau d'un émminent scientifique, vous évoluerez à echelle nanométrique dans les méandres de cyclotrons infernaux.

Courez pauvres fous, ou fuyez, mais dans tout les cas vous devrez braver vos limites pour découvrir les mystérieuses particules quantiques "manquantes".

Physicien théoricien, ou assistant de renom, vous n'avez qu'un but, découvrir le mystérieux boson "X" déjà prédit il y a des décénnies.

Se présentant sous la forme d'un runner aux contrôles simplistes mais intenses, vous vous entendrez pousser des "waaouuh" de bonheur lors de vos escapades "quarkiennes", des sauts quantiques oui, mais des bonds également, de géant.

24209218.review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Boson X
[b]Developer:[/b]  Ian MacLarty & Jon Kerney
[b]Publisher:[/b]  Ian MacLarty
[b]Genre:[/b]  Endless Runner

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
Boson X is precisely the reason some indie developers need to keep receiving support on Steam. We’re having in front of ourselves a game formula that has been done to death. Endless-running arcade. What could this title possibly bring new to the table? But it does. Apart from the pretty 3D graphics and large texture diversity, the very concept of a particle collider and the rotational mechanics that it involves are enough to garner interest here. It’s an addictive game, that’s for certain. And fairly difficult to master, even if it leads to rage quitting too often. Your mileage may vary but Boson X is fully deserving of its asking price and has both Cards and Achievements.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Nice graphics and sounds.
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Difficulty spikes.

[b]Rating 8/10[/b]

【PS2：在游戏中，你只需要左右或者向前方跳跃；地上的浅蓝发亮区域是计程使用，只有在那上面跑过了一定的距离才算过关，过关程度在画面左上角有显示；但并非达到100%就完事了；100%之后，速度会有一个质的提升，背景也瞬间高大上起来；外星人试了两次，都是在刚109%的时候就掉进了虚空......有好友说这是个非常虐心的游戏，不过作为迷索尼克（可老玩不好的那种悲催）之人，这点挫折算不了什么；人物有青年屌丝，中年眼镜大叔，迷之机器人可选，一旦过了100%，就会有新的关卡开启；只不过我还在第一关徘徊，想要不断的刷新百分比；相信尝试过的人，多半会和我一样吧？】

总而言之，简而言之------

评分满分，严重推荐，打折时候还不入简直暴殄天物。

22565394.review:
[h1]"So this is what science looks like... Dude, why are my hands so huge..?"[/h1]

What would you get from putting three physicists in a room with unlimited supply of drugs? You would probably get three overdosed scientists and no progress made but in the universe of Boson X drug infuced trips seem to be the main method of doing science.

[b]Boson X[/b] is an interesting arcade runner game that has interesting soundtracks, trippy visuals and sometimes unforgiving difficulty. Boson X handles close to any other 3D-runner game out there but the main difference being the visual tricks. Boson X plays with your head. A lot. There are situations that may seem impossible to get through but after  thinking for a second you will realize it was just a visual trick to make it look harder than it is. The main problem is that you have less than a second to react. Boson X's gameplay is really interesting since you have to memorize different parts of the levels which, for some poeple, may be the main reason not to buy the game. If you enjoy trial and error type of games this game is just right for you. The levels are short but they require quite some time to memorize each part of the level.

Other than the gameplay, Boson X doesn't have much going. The graphics are simple yet fine looking, the soundtrack is fun to listen to yet not really memorable but don't let that scare you away since the gameplay is fun and depending on your skills Boson X will offer many hours of fun runner type gameplay.

22289919.review:
One of my favourite games. I keep coming back to this one, its a timeless classic to me.

You run around a level varying from mostly hexagonal (and once pentagonal and once dual) levels jumping to and running on platforms. Energy platforms increase your energy which you need to get to 100% to advance to the next level. The higher your energy %, the faster you move forward so the harder it gets.

I used to play the free version until I discovered there was a paid one with extra levels. I just like the whole concept of easy-to-learn, hard-to-master with progressive difficulty (and levels are dynamic, sections are randomly placed together so no run will ever be the exactly same, but they are similar enough to learn the patterns). Not to mention I personally like the art style.

It reminds me of Zone mode from Wipeout HD.

Definitely worth the money from my perspective. But you should probably try the free version first to see if its your kind of game.

I just turn off the in-game sound and music, play some of my own music and relax while playing.

22201476.review:
If you ever need to practice not blinking for extended periods of time, then you've come to the right place.  Or if you just want some of the most tense gameplay you'll ever experience, then this will also be for you.  As someone who normally doesn't like fast-paced games like these, I was surprised by how much I enjoy Boson X.  It has a very unique concept (though prone to comparisons with Super Hexagon, which came out around the same time) and it continually gets interesting in new ways.

It only has 18 levels, six of which I had already played in the alpha version before release, but the game does not get stale at any point.  Every level does something unique and forces the player to get used to a new challenge before continuing to the next one.  The pace of the game forces players to think quickly before making a decision, usually ending in instant death, but steady progress makes the deaths feel rewarding regardless of how difficult the levels are.

Like many other hardcore games, the feeling of completing a level is very satisfying, but due to the simplicity of the game's mechanics and the innovation that is done with the game's simplicity, the frustration that usually accompanies that feeling is present to a far smaller degree than usual.  The different aesthetics of each level are an integral factor to the level's challenge, but they also look absolutely beautiful at times and give each stage its own identity. The Dark X Boson level in particular has a creative design that both looks incredible and takes a very long time to get used to.

There is only one negative aspect I've found with the game, and that is the soundtrack.  The music is repetitive and gets annoying very quickly as a level is attempted many times.  Fortunately, the game gives the option to mute the music so that players can choose their own soundtrack.  It's sometimes easier to simply play in silece as it allows for uninterrupted focus on the game.

This game is definitely worth the $3 for several hours of exciting gameplay and very well designed levels.  I cannot recommend Boson X enough.

21877374.review:
“Если здравый смысл и противоречит идее путешествия во времени, то законы квантовой физики — нет.”

Эта игра - Runner (бег с препятствиями), за пять рублей по скидке, которые очень удачно отбиваются по стоимости благодаря карточкам, которые вы сможете продать на торговой площадке в Steam.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=646636342

Жанр игр runner’ов всегда был разделен на два типа: бесплатные игры, которые не имеют конца и в которые надо донатить что бы бежать дальше (наподобие Subway Surfers) и платные, которые как правило имеют конец и гораздо сложнее сами по себе (по типу BIT.TRIP)

Действие игры происходит в ускорителе частиц в который вы попали, на выбор дается три героя, которые ничем друг от друга не отличаются, зато карты отличаются достаточно сильно, хотя бы по способу создания дорог.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=646645927

Пожалуй главной особенностью игры является то, что она видится нам как конусовидная и по всем правилам физики бесконечно стремится вперед, создавая перед вами путь, на котором вам необходимо заполнять шкалу энергии (бегая по ярким плитам), чтобы выбраться.

Игра сложная и с каждым прохождением уровня будет открывать новый и более трудный. Всего уровней 18, каждый со своими интересными алгоритмами создания дорог и препятствий.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=646646363

Минус у игры один - не отзывчивое управление и в отличие от других Runner’ов тут нельзя как либо управлять своим полетом в воздухе или делать “двойной прыжок”, так что если вы играете с клавиатуры, а не с геймпада, вполне возможно вас ждет разочарование.

Музыка... вполне сойдет для игры за 5 рублей, но я получаю больше удовольствия от прослушивания своих треков во время игры, нежели чем от внутриигрового саундтрека.
 Если вы любите Runner'ы и вам вполне понравилось то что происходит в трейлере игры, то смело берите по скидке.

9 из 10

21539739.review:
[h1] So this is what physicists do in their spare time! [/h1]


Just finished this game! Finally.


If you have played Super Hexagon or other related games, then you will notice that this game is actually quite similar: Both as hard as fuck.


Boson X is a fast-paced action game where you are either a male/female physicist, or a lab robot. Your mission is to fill a certain meter (that which goes up to 100%) to pass that level, and an optional task to make it even higher.



Kudos to the company that made and published this game into Steam! I wasn't able to play this on mobile since I found this one on Steam first, but all-in-all it's good!


[b] Pros: [/b]
- Very fluid gameplay
- Good BGM brings energy and tension while you play. The techno music fits very well
- Over 18 levels to complete and master
- Simple controls. It takes less time for you to master them
- Simple graphics yet the background colors makes it engaging and immerseful
- LEADERBOARDS! Perfect for [b] Bragging Rights [/b]

[b] Cons: [/b]
- In [i] rare [/i] occurances, some key inputs do not work, leading you to fail or misstep. It may be due to over-pressing the same key, or just a bug. Either way, if you chance to experience this, it is very frustrating
- When you get deeper into the levels of the game, the BGM tends to be repetitive and boring. Also the BGMs are only few.
- Aside from the 18 levels, there are nothing more to do, probably to aim high into the Leaderboards
- Some levels have very bright colors, to very dark and confusing color blocks. Makes it hard to time when you will land and/or aim for a higher score when you finish the level. Of course, practice is key
- Leaderboards are so full of cheaters. If I were you, I'd steer clear of it. There are some who have 5000% scores on most levels. Insane right? It's a shame because it ruins the endgame achievement.


Overall, this game is great. If you are not fond of Leaderboards, then you will finish this in 7-10 hours or so.

This game requires a lot of focus and patience. Not doing so will make you rage every time you fail. If you are that type of person, I'd best stay away from this game.


But, should you want to try this, get ready to immerse in a game full of jumping, side-stepping, LSD environment, MLG moments, multiple retries, and failure-induced raging.

20780054.review:
Boson X, at first feeble glance, resembles your atypical polygonal-based "endless running"-type game. Everything else after this fact about Boson X is bloody incredible and leaves others similar far behind. Nothing comes close.

Nothing. Well, maybe an actual GoPro INSIDE the Large Hadron Collider at Cern.

Picture this, if you dare: You are a human in the actual particle-smashing apparatus known as the Large Hadron Collider, bouncing over and through delicate remnants of other debris and items in the speeding particle stream attempting to discover new particles. As you play through each of the parkour-esque bouncing levels, swirling around your every move, you realize - suddenly - that nighttime has come and gone and you're already late for work. Again.

Boson X is worth 20x what they charge at full price. Everyone deserves to play this before they collide into a towering pillar because I THOUGHT I MOVED LEFT.

20725720.review:
Dieses Spiel ist extrem schwer. Wohl eher etwas für Masochisten, die glücklich sind, wenn sie versuchen mit einem Deltoidalikositetraeder eine 24 zu würfeln, und man ihnen bei jeder anderen Zahl mit Anlauf in die Leiste tritt. Immer und immer wieder...

Jetzt werden einige sagen: "Vielleicht bist du einfach nur zu langsam, deswegen ist das Spiel doch nicht schlecht!" Aber ich sage gar nicht, dass es schlecht ist, ich kann es nur nicht empfehlen, weil es meiner Meinung nach einen Unterschied gibt zu anderen schweren Spielen, wie zum Beispiel Super Meat Boy, welches mir übrigens sehr gut gefällt, trotz des hohen Schwierigkeitsgrades.

Wie ihr im Video auf der Shopseite sehen könnt, rennt man durch zufallsgenerierte Level, die man abschließt, indem man 100% erreicht. Sobald man einen Fehler macht, startet man wieder bei 0%. Die Prozentzahl steigt allerdings nur, wenn man über die blauen Felder läuft, die -und das ist der Haken- ebenfalls zufällig auf der Strecke erscheinen. Es kann also sein, dass ihr sehr weit kommt, aber leider keine blauen Felder erscheinen, und das ist extrem frustrierend. 

Super Meat Boy hingegen hat mich nie frustriert, egal wie oft ich an einem Level gescheitert bin, denn ich wusste immer, wo der (Bedienungs-) Fehler war. Und andersherum war es um so befriedigender, wenn ich es dann irgendwann geschafft hatte, denn ich wusste, es war eine Belohnung für die Ausdauer, die ich investierte, um endlich diese besonders knifflige Stelle zu meistern.

Boson X gibt mir keine Motivation, es weiter zu probieren, weil letztendlich das Glück entscheidet. Was schade ist, denn die innovative Spielidee gefällt mir eigentlich ganz gut.

Als eventuell vergleichbares Spiel empfehle ich stattdessen:
[url=store.steampowered.com/app/218060/]BIT.TRIP Presents... Runner2: Future Legend of Rhythm Alien[/url]

20515680.review:
Boson X has been a favorite of mine ever since I bought it off the App Store during Christmas of 2014. The shape-shifting platforms, progress updates, and scientifically enhanced optical illusions are what set this apart to many other rage games.

You're placed in this massive particle accelerator, which could arguably be the Large Hadron Collider, where you must land on cyan colored platforms to raise the peak energy of the particle you're attempting to unearth. Reaching 100% energy results in successfully discovering a new particle, and each particle (level) presents you with new gauntlets of varying speeds and obstacles. The gameplay is a tiny bit similar to Super Hexagon, where you must traverse a shapeshifting polygon to progress towards level completion.

The game's base price should suit the amount of time you'll get out of it. Boson X isn't as hard as Super Hexagon, but it's still a great endurance test that'll enhance your reflexes. Plus, the achievements are very straightforward and simple to obtain.

Well, I finally finished the game, so I might as well review it. Kinda.

Now, before anything else, if you have doubts of buying this game, go download the free version. you can find that just by searching for Boson X and it should be right up at the top.

...You back? Ok.

If you still have doubt if you want to buy it, the extra levels add some interesting replayability. For starters, outside of the original 6 levels, the new levels aren't confined to 10 walls/floors, and have as low as 2. As for the replayability itself, it depends on if you like runners or not in general. If you do, great! 18 levels to test your endless runner skills. If not, and you've played the demo/free version, than it may not be for you.

...who am I kidding? Of course you want it!... unless you can't drop 3 bucks on it or HATE runners with a passion.

Get this game, slam your face into the walls a thousand times, and celebrate when you finally finish your first X Boson Level. Oh, don't forget to die on Geon for me, okay?

20298038.review:
Boson X - научная игра-раннер от третьего лица, представляющая собой преодоление элементарных частиц (именуемых бозонами) сквозь квантовые поля. В игре присутствуют три вида квантовых полей, каждое из которых в свою очередь делится ещё на шесть полей со своими элементарными частицами. Таким образом, всего имеется 18 квантовых полей, получая за прохождение любой из них отдельное достижение. 
   В игре доступны три персонажа, которыми нам предстоит управлять: женщина - главный профессор по имени Нива, мужчина - директор по исследованиям Эрик, и робот - лабораторный сотрудник по имени Кеиро. 
   Для прохождения квантового поля мы должны как можно чаще наступать на специальные светящиеся платформы, они позволяют нам бежать намного быстрее и, что самое главное, засчитывают проценты прохождения по ним. Однако и после достижения 100% вы можете продолжать свой бег, пока не провалитесь в бездну или не столкнётесь с каким-нибудь препятствием.
   Одной из важных особенностей игры является чрезмерная быстрота. Никогда не знаешь, как там, вдалеке, сложатся платформы, чтобы молниеносно перестроиться с одного ряда на другой и удачно наступить на них. Вот поэтому меня и разачаровало не очень удобное управление на клавиатуре - вовремя не нажмёшь ту или иную кнопку - всё, начинай уровень сначала.
   Также хотелось бы уделить внимание музыкальному сопровождению во время игры - оно местами нудное и затянутое, хотя и звучит в каждом уровне разное. Мне лично понравилась музыка, которая присутствует сразу в двух местах - после прохождения любого уровня и на официальной странице игры в магазине Steam.
   Доски почёта Steam - ещё одна особенность Boson X. Вот где нужно проявить себя, показать, сколько сотен процентов пробежал! А коллекционные карточки? Если купить игру с большой скидкой, ещё и в плюс выйдешь!
   В итоге, Boson X - яркая, непредсказуемая игра, с оригинальной выдумкой в виде необычного места прохождения, позволит вам проявить реакцию на скорость и быстрое принятие решений.

20187590.review:
I played the free version of Boson X a while ago. I actually forgot about it but remember it being pretty enjoyable so decided to give it a shot when I saw it on sale here.

Boson X is really fun and addictive running game. It's got some great twists on the usual conventions. The way in which you jump from each platform took some time to adapt to and was quite frustrating at first. Once you push a certain direction, you've committed to that direction, until you land again. Holding the direction makes you jump longer gaps. Once you get the technique down, it's incredibly satisfying.

The visuals and music are both appealing. The feel of the game is great and it all comes together well. Despite retrying levels endlessly, the music still works and adds to the experience without becoming annoying which is always a possibility in games like this.

One thing that is slightly annoying is that the levels are in sections which seem to randomly shuffle each time. And the way to complete the level is to run across enough blue tiles. Therefore sometimes you can be running for longer than your previous attempts but have a [i]less[/i] percentage of completion than those attempts. Didn't stop me from retrying the level though...

19989500.review:
This game is a great time waster and it is also really fun while it lasts.

It is one of those endless runners where the game autoruns for you and you have to dodge obstacles that come towards you except it has its own unique twist. The game plays out like you are running down a tube and to avoid obstacles, you can jump forward or one step to either side. The aim is to run over blue sections of the ground to "discover" a particle. As you charge it up, the game increases in speed and once you reach 100% charge, you unlock a new level but you can continue running to get highscores. Every level has a few different patterns that repeat randomly and all the levels have their own unique patterns.

The game is really fun to play and although it is quite short, it is definitely worth the price.

19953543.review:
Признаюсь, я не эксперт по жанру тоннельных бегалок, поэтому сравнить почти не с чем, но игра приятно удивляет! Дизайн тоннелей - отменный и бросает новый вызов с каждым новым тоннелем. Например, один тоннель может быть очень быстрый и длинный - нужно научиться не совершать ошибок на сравнительно простой полосе препятствий! Другой - со странной перспективой и выпуклыми платформами, и нужно научиться учитывать высоту прыжков. Есть также минимум один уровень, где вместо шестигранного тоннеля - двухгранный, то есть обращение гравитации. Управление точное и отсутствует прокачка, поэтому главная задача игры (на глаз определять миг и длину прыжка) выполняется исключительно за счёт собственного навыка игрока. Сюжет - бег за физика в коллайдере - прекрасно гармонирует с оформлением и даёт поводы для шуток о науке (а в такую игру очень приятно играть совместно, по очереди), а также чтения Википедии об интересных частицах. Не могу представить эту игру такой же увлекательной ни на какую другую тему - абстрактные, фэнтезиийные или космические тоннели оставляют совершенно иное впечатление.

Единственная загвоздка - при управлении с геймпада, чтобы прыгнуть, не меняя дорожки, нужно нажать оба шифта, что непривычно. В принципе, на геймпаде по умолчанию почти все кнопки забиты под тот или иной прыжок, и, если не получится привыкнуть, можно нажимать А, к примеру. Но за в нажатии обоих шифтов есть логика - по центру на геймпаде обычно игровых кнопок нет, да и тянуться за ними было бы далеко.

19742081.review:
[b]Boson X[/b]. An fast-paced indie platformer that requires a lot of memorization of patterns to get you through.

It seems that the objective is to help two (or three if you consider a robot one) scientists discover three particles by traveling through some visual starfield. The goal is to run along blue platforms that emerge from the endless void around you, building up enough energy to spark a particle. This task, as you progress, isn't as easy as it seems as newer stages bring forth new obstacles, may it be moving white flats, fragile red flats, thick walls, and even rings that emit electric currents. All this game really needs is mind power and complete concentration.

[h1]Review[/h1]
[b]The Good[/b]
Boson X has proven its to be a worthy challenge, taking nearly months to actually beat all levels (for me anyways). At first glance, I truly thought I had what it took to beat it, to little avail. Up until you reach a certain point, the game provides a nice, minimalistic and basic gameplay that can be enjoyed... if you're into games like this one, of course. The music that plays in the six stages is also pretty fine as well.

[b]The Bad[/b]
While this game doesn't a lot, I can't seem to find a lot of bad things to say about it aside from no real replay material implemented into it. That's... about all I can point out atm.

[h1]Concluding Comments[/h1]
It's a pretty intense but exciting little game that I somewhat find kinda funny too if you manage to envelop yourself deep into the game, not pressing to strive straight for instant wins or even trying to beat the game. And if you're one to shoot for those top ranks on the leaderboards, I wish you greatest luck for you. I'm sure there are very many already high up, but who's to say you can't get up there?

--Hermix.

19247252.review:
I recommend playing this game to some extent. The first 2 sets of levels (possibly the top 3 on the last set) are difficult enough to be rewarding, provide a good skill curve, and are very interesting both visually and conceptually. However, the rng elements of the game become increasingly infuriating in the last couple of levels, outweighing the reward of improving and passing each pattern section of the levels.

Some of the level design is questionable, for example on the anti Y boson level, the platforms in one pattern section are actually hidden and completely non visible until it is too late to react. On other levels, the visuals, though overall excellent, can cause issues with vision on where to go next.

I definitely don't regret buying this, but I wouldn't recommend this for everyone, especially for people like me who don't play games like this very frequently.

18742427.review:
Boson X is a relatively interesting concept on building a simple yet fast-paced endless runner. Sadly the game suffers from poor pacing, a painfully gaudy color palette , a very steep difficulty curve and somewhat badly designed levels that will frustrate Boson X players more than challenge them. While the game states that you need quick reflexes to succeed, you will find yourself relying blind luck (and a fair bit of patience) to hit that '100% discovered' meter. The only real reason I am positively recommending this game is that it does offer a fair amount of value (in terms of gameplay) for what it costs to buy. Also, there is no 'Average' rating.

P.S. If you or anyone near you will be playing with suffer from photo sensitivity, there's a very real chance of triggering a seizure as there's a lot of flashing lights and fast moving objects.

Rating = 2.5/5

18499911.review:
Boson X 是一款编写的很精致的3D游戏。Boson X 的引擎主要是 Lua 写的，游戏才12M，足可体现程序猿的功力。

游戏大致意思是，实验室有3位物（shen）理（jing）学（bing）家（ren），一男一女一机器，他们整天研究三维空间 XYZ，你要做的是帮助这些天（feng）才（zi）探索未知的世界。至于探索的方式，就是在一个六边形的六条边上左右跳跃，在蓝色加速板上飞奔积攒能量，直到100%达成。游戏里面的人物可以在普通板上飞奔，也可以在红色沉降板上飞奔，抑或是蓝色加速板上，需要注意的是随着能量的蓄积，主角移动速度会变得越来越快，同时某些关卡主人公的空中下落速度会变化，稍不留意就摔成粉末了。别看我上面描述的很简单，玩起来就根本不是那回事了，以至于我这群好友里面没有一个比我进度高的（尽管我才通关16个）。X 维度关卡还算简单，基本上两次就过了，Y 维度关卡相比就要难了不少，Y 的最后一关我还没有过，因为眼睛实在受不了了。Z 的最后一关简直就是变态，懒得玩下去了。

英文版介绍有这么一句：“No superfluous powerups, coins or XP systems - just deadly serious scientific research”，有点 troll 的感觉。我觉得游戏设计越简单，往往大家都认为很难。游戏没有任何道具，去掉了随机性，[spoiler]是时候随手截图证明大手子了[/spoiler]。

小建议：玩一会儿就不要玩了，重试次数过多，你容易 ragequit。

18486639.review:
Overview
Boson X is a rotational infinite runner with a nice premise, addictive gameplay and challenging difficulty. You play as one of three characters of your choosing and run along platforms inside a particle accelerator, in the hopes of discovering a new one! This is one of those games that is simple to grasp, but hard to play! If you thought Super Hexagon was fun and difficult, well, now you have this Decagon to try and master!

The Pros:
Fitting Visuals - The game's focus on fast moving objects and rapid player movements make choosing this minimalist art style very fitting. There are no textures, just solid colors, and it just works! You won't get distracted by textures, instead all your attention is to be averted to your movements. Also, it kind of makes sense, as you are travelling between particles. Things to small to have textures (or geometrical shapes, for that matter, but we'll let this one slide).

Level Generation - The levels are put together using procedural generation, but not by randomness, There are modules put together in a random order. So, once you'll play enough of a level, you will start to get used to the more difficult steps. This is great, because you can learn without having to go through the same level over and over if you fail.
What's more, each level has it's own theme - different modules, different speeds, different color schemes and even unique pieces!

Addictive in Nature - Even though later levels will make you want to scream because of how hard they are, dying is sometimes enjoyable, and just makes you want to play again, because you are confident you can pull it off! Also, a great game to play when bored.

Scoring and Leaderboards - Instead of scoring you on how long you stay alive, or how far you've gone, the game scores you in percentages, and that increases each time you run on blue platforms. Once you reach 100%, you pass the level, and go into a sort of hyperdrive with increased speed, a change of color scheme and significantly increased difficulty. Leaderboards are also wonderfully done, with scores broke down by level, in total, and friend comparison.

Reasonable Achievements - The achievements are all based on finishing the levels. There are 18 in total, but don't think this will be an easy feat. You may be surprised how challenging this game can get.

Cons:
Surprisingly.. None - It's rare I never find a con in a game. This one is the exception that enforces the rule. The game does what it sets to: Gives an addictive, infinite runner game, with no garbage on the side - just plain, good, challenging fun. For people that would consider the difficulty a con, you are missing the point. For this genre, a more merciful experience will do nothing but dampening the fun.

Conclusion:
If you like infinite runners, are up for a challenge and you want a great game for cheap (also featured on sales for next to nothing), this is an easy purchase. Buy with confidence.

If you enjoyed this review and want to see more of my work, consider joining my group and follow my curator page! Link to the right!	Jad's List - Curator Group

18317897.review:
Depending on how good you are, this game could last only ~4 hours. To beat everything, it took me ~5 hours.

The game itself is like 12MB. Must be the cel-shading, but it's incredibly compressed. Runs quite smoothly, music is great, and level design remains interesting throughout. Not overly drawn out, and getting the jist of each level as you run through it feels great. Simple but very fluid mechanics make for a very addicting experience. For it's price, it's a lot of fun. 

When you have an incredibly intense run, you'll feel like an absolute badass. I love that feeling. Recommended, it's a quick, well-executed, arcade-like experience that is quite difficult, but not impossible. It's not cheap difficulty, when you lose, you know you made a mistake, not that you were cheated out by RNG or something. (RNG can occasionally make your run impossible to complete though if you are in the wrong place at the wrong time.)

18285838.review:
This is a very lighthearted free-running type of game very similar to something like Subway Surfers. There are 18 levels here of varying difficulty; from Normal Geon to Anti-Boson X. I have spent 4 hours collecting achievements (beating the game) and the rest of my time shooting for top 1000 (then 500) scores on each level.

I played the free version before this, but the Dark and Anti versions of each particle were a pleasant new feature. They are NOT retools or reskins of one another.  Each stage usually retains the same core structure (gravitron likes moving/falling platforms, Y boson is a big fan of electric beams, etc.) but otherwise each level is fresh and unique.

Players with slow reaction times WILL have trouble with the later levels. This game gets pretty darn rediculous, especially once you take on the Anti particles. Anti Gravitron had me stuck for a good 30 minutes (1/8 of the time I was playing).

This is a very good game in my opinion. While it may not be a genre-definer like Super Meat Boy or a masterfully crafted experience like Limbo, it's nice for good quick fun, a coffee break or a reflex test.

18273839.review:
Привет!
Псевдонаучная псевдоигра, в которой ты работаешь вычислителем криптовалют для новых, более совершенных цивилизаций.
Успеха можно достичь как и в реальности только используя своего рода ускоритель, допинг.
Пытаешься найти логику в построении блоков, но её нет. Твоя цель безполезна. Единственный способ избавиться от бега -  поскорее умирать, не пытаясь применять допинг, а также ты понимаешь, что даже если ты выйдешь, то незаменимых людей [и роботов] не бывает, и на твоё место найдут более молодых кандидатов, чьё сердечко ещё не испорчено допингом. Твой выход ничего не изменит. Не проблема, если от биткойн-сети будет отколот изолированый кусочек пользователей — впоследствии все отколотые транзакции войдут в более длинную цепочку.
всегда побеждает наиболее длинная цепочка блоков.

18204503.review:
[h1]Пробегись в ускорителе частиц :)[/h1]

Начну пожалуй с того, что у игры стоит метка "Сложная". Сложновата на последних (Anti X)  уровнях. В остальном - всё вполне проходимо.
Итак. Boson X - раннер, в котором нам предстоит пробежать в ускорителе частиц (particle accelerator). Всего таких уровней/трасс здесь 18 штук. На выбор нам дано 3 персонажа - ученые женщина и мужчина, и робот. Вот в принципе и всё.

[h1]Что понравилось:[/h1]

♥ [u]Раннер.[/u] Я просто люблю раннеры.
♥ [u]Минимализм.[/u] Ничего отвлекающего, есть только дорожки, на которые нужно перебегать/перепрыгивать и фон.
♥ [u]Доска почета Steam.[/u] Любителям покрасоваться на первых строчках это понравится, хотя после 100% прохождения трассы, она не заканчивается, а продолжается (101%, 102%). Поэтому оказаться в топе лучших довольно сложно.
♥ [u]Уровни.[/u] Каждый из уровней отличается цветом, формами дорожек и скоростью. Итого мы имеем 18 разнообразных уровней.
♥ [u]Коллекционные карточки и достижения.[/u]
♥ [u]Цена.[/u] Лично я брал по скидке и вышло в 8 рублей. Неплохо.

[h1]Что не понравилось:[/h1]

♦ [u]Музыка.[/u] Унылая. Просто унылая, советую катать под свое музло.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

[i]Добротный раннер, в меру сложный, но не HARD. Любителям раннеров - брать, а по скидке - брать всем :). Рекомендую!

С надеждой на то, что у Вас получится пройти игру в один заход, Aikiro, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators/discussions/9/517142253868455013/]Ораторы Ste@m[/url].[/i]

18179095.review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie 

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

Final Score: 9.5/10

18104456.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
[i]Boson X[/i] is a rotational infinite runner with a nice premise, addictive gameplay and challenging difficulty. You play as one of three characters of your choosing and run along platforms inside a particle accelerator, in the hopes of discovering a new one! This is one of those games that is simple to grasp, but hard to play! If you thought [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Jadarma/recommended/221640]Super Hexagon[/url] was fun and difficult, well, now you have this Decagon to try and master!

[h1]The Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Fitting Visuals[/b] - The game's focus on fast moving objects and rapid player movements make choosing this minimalist art style very fitting. There are no textures, just solid colors, and it just works! You won't get distracted by textures, instead all your attention is to be averted to your movements. Also, it kind of makes sense, as you are travelling between particles. Things to small to have textures (or geometrical shapes, for that matter, but we'll let this one slide).

[*][b]Level Generation[/b] - The levels are put together using procedural generation, but not by randomness, There are modules put together in a random order. So, once you'll play enough of a level, you will start to get used to the more difficult steps. This is great, because you can learn without having to go through the same level over and over if you fail.
What's more, each level has it's own theme - different modules, different speeds, different color schemes and even unique pieces!

[*][b]Addictive in Nature[/b] - Even though later levels will make you want to scream because of how hard they are, dying is sometimes enjoyable, and just makes you want to play again, because you are confident you can pull it off! Also, a great game to play when bored.

[*][b]Scoring and Leaderboards[/b] - Instead of scoring you on how long you stay alive, or how far you've gone, the game scores you in percentages, and that increases each time you run on blue platforms. Once you reach 100%, you pass the level, and go into a sort of [i]hyperdrive[/i] with increased speed, a change of color scheme and significantly increased difficulty. Leaderboards are also wonderfully done, with scores broke down by level, in total, and friend comparison.

[*][b]Reasonable Achievements[/b] - The achievements are all based on finishing the levels. There are 18 in total, but don't think this will be an easy feat. You may be surprised how challenging this game can get.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Surprisingly.. None[/b] - It's rare I never find a con in a game. This one is the exception that enforces the rule. The game does what it sets to: Gives an addictive, infinite runner game, with no garbage on the side - just plain, good, challenging fun. For people that would consider the difficulty a con, you are missing the point. For this genre, a more merciful experience will do nothing but dampening the fun.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
If you like infinite runners, are up for a challenge and you want a great game for cheap (also featured on sales for next to nothing), this is an easy purchase. Buy with confidence.

Изначально игра выглядит очень интересно: классная стилизация, эффектное построение рандомных уровней, симпатичная музыка и простота геймплея - всего-то 3 клавиши жать, прыжок и стрейф-джампы. Bittrip Runner 3D.
Но затем вылезает проблема геймдизайна - рандом убивает весь геймплей. И если в первых двух уровнях ещё можно как-то спланировать свои действия, прослеживая издали, как строится уровень, то дальше всё упирается в удачу и упёртость игрока: стандартом будет то, что правильным маршрут вы увидите в последний момент, когда уже поздно; да и зачастую единственный предоставленный проход будет невозможно пропрыгать.
Брать советую лишь отъявленным мазохистам, которым не жалко ни времени, ни нервов.

18073984.review:
First of all, you shouldn't play this game if you're looking to relax. Like seriously, you're only going to get yourself more stressed than you already were on first place. Although I had my share of fun, now that I've finished it, I never want to see it again. So please devs, don't you dare to make a sequel such as 'Boson X² - The revenge' because I'll surely buy it and probably write another similar review (if I actually manage to survive until the end).
Ok, now for an overall scope: The graphics are ok, the soundtrack not that much but that's ok, because I've played while listening to my own playlist. The level design is simply insane and somehow reminded of this DOS game called 'Skyroads' (which I always loved). Besides that, it's really cool the fact that you're able to select different characters to play with, because it'd be unfair for a single soul to receive such a large amount of punishment during the research. Last but not least, if you're looking for a good challenge for a fair price, this game is definitely for you.

Now just as a bonus, here's a transcript of my experience with this game: 


[h1]New Level[/h1]

- These textures are seriously broken! Oh wait, it's meant to be like that.
- Look at THAT. I'll never get through this thing.


[h1]Deaths[/h1]

- So why am I still alive? Ah, of course, I'm not.
- What does this blinking red platform do? Oh, that...
- Oh no, not that crazy pattern once more...
- What the...?! Three of these in a row! Three in a bloody row!!!
- Dang! I won't make that mistake again!
- ... I've just made the same mistake again.
- Come on, I definitely kept the button pressed on that jump.
- Almost there! I'm gonna make it! I'm gonna make it! No, I'm not...
- 99,18%!!! Oh, the humanity!!!
- Well, I suppose that it can't get harder than that...
- ... It actually can.


[h1]Level Cleared[/h1]

- 100%!!! Yeah, now let's try to... Aaand I'm dead.
- Yay, I can't wait to see my ranking position! Oh, never mind...


[i]* rinse and repeat until the end *[/i]

18030587.review:
This really is an overlooked simple but well made little game. I noticed and picked up Boson X when it appeared in the weekly offers at -90% on the Steam store, less than a year after release and that was clearly a steal. It's a small rotational platform runner title that clearly went unnoticed and despite being fairly short and lacking much content, it's definitely worth picking up when on sale, if not at full price.

[h1]Highlights[/h1]

Most of the low priced little indie titles on Steam aren't well realized, or come with too many problems to be worth the hassle, but Boson X is short and comes together really nicely. It's polished more than you'd expect and the sound and especially the music in particular is worth noting for being fast paced, at times thumping, and fun, while also tying into the levels really well.

The entire game is packaged under a scientific theme of physics, and from the chemistry lab looking title screen which reminded me of Half-Life 2 and Portal, to the physicist and particle references, it's themed subtly but well and compliments the gameplay.

The random placement of the platforming elements falling into place along with the randomized directions, speeds and distances of certain things all make for a changing difficulty and unpredictable level. Some of the earlier and later levels in particular can be both easy and very challenging in the same playthrough, and it added a small level of that "want to play again" and "just one more try" feeling.

[h1]Mistakes & Annoyances[/h1]

There are some annoyances with this title, but at the price and length they're mostly forgiveable, but more so they don't actively break the game and don't take away very much overall.

As mentioned, there's a nice level of unpredictability built in by the random selection of speeds, times and platform locations which probably adds more than it takes away, but at times it's definitely more annoying than if the section had been given fixed timings. Dying at the same sections because there's no way to predict the placement of a block up ahead, or crossing lightning paths which may make it impossible to chose a safe direction are frustrating more than they need to be and should have had more attention spent on at least making them more fluid. In short, the game is often unfair, and that's the last thing you want in a game involving precision, timing and player planning.

The other complaint is the lack of content or length of gameplay which clocks in at an average of around 5-6 hours, which is great value for money, but because the mechanics are fairly flat, even unexciting at a push, it means there isn't anything to make you go wow or keep you engaged for very long. The developer has mentioned all the open license libraries and given links to the engine and more in the file directory, presumably to encourage modding/development, but Steam Workshop is a common request and honestly would've added a lot to this title, it's a shame it hasn't been added.

[h1]Recommendations[/h1]

Fully priced, Boson X is available on Steam at just £1.99/2.99€/$2.99 and with an average gameplay length of 5-6 hours, it's great value for money. It's also regularly on sale for as much as 90% off, which makes it nearly free. It's probably not going to rock your socks off and keep you playing, and if you have a long backlog it might be worth missing out on, but at the price it's a fine pick up for anyone taking an interest from the store page.

* You can actively edit and/or replace the music and sound via the /data directory. You can even edit the character models and animations.
* Run, a flash game with similar, albeit flatter mechanics is available [url=http://www.coolmath-games.com/0-run]on Coolmath[/url], [url=http://www.kongregate.com/games/player_03/run]Kongregate[/url] and other sites to play for free.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/302610
[code]Unedited review notes 14/09/2015 for Boson X:

+Great soundtrack
+Science related title screen/character orientation etc is a nice theme
+Difficult and unpredictable gameplay
-Difficult and unpredictable gameplay at later stages, dying because of my mistakes is fine, dying because it's near impossible to progress due to random timing is bad
-Lacking content, steam workshop would've went a long way and made this something special
[/code]

18023537.review:
Normalmente Jogos de Runner em terceira pessoa são muito populares em móbiles e para  passar o tempo no ônibus ou coisas do gênero,seria capaz Boson X ter seu destaque no mundo dos runners para plataformas como a Steam e ser um titulo indie grande?

Boson X é um jogo indie  com o gênero  runner que saiu do mundo dos móbiles e veio para a Steam em 2014,o jogo em si tem uma mecânica bem simples no qual o único objetivo do jogador é pular plataformas e correr em outras azuis te dando mais velocidade e pontos para passar de nível.

Existem três tipos de mundo com cada um tendo 6 fases diferentes e desafiadoras no qual requer atenção e concentração total do jogador,seus níveis vão dificultando ao decorrer do game,fazendo que cada pulo frontal e lateral sejam certeiros para não cair ou errar as plataformas,também existe o fator gravidade em Boson X,aonde velocidade que o jogo vai te propondo e seus pulos te impulsionam a ir em plataformas mais distantes,lembrando que quanto mais segurar o botão de pulo,maior ele será.

Os Graficos são bem simples modelados para Mobile,logo não é uma coisa tão incrível no computador,são bem quadradões e com pernas pontiagudas,ao ficar mais rápido o personagem parece que esta tendo um piripaque do que correndo ou tendo uma animação de corrida,sua trilha sonora também não é das mais incríveis,se tornando enjoativas ao decorrer do tempo de jogatina.

Um dos grandes problemas de Boson X é a falta de mecânica de conseguir ir para os lados em quanto você esta pulando,sem falar de sentir esses pulos travados e um pouco estranho.muitas vezes você morrera por esse pequeno detalhe que faz muita falta.

Mesmo assim Boson x é um jogo que vai te viciar aos poucos e desafiar suas habilidades ao decorrer de sua jogatina,cada fase tem um gênero cor ou mudança de textura para deixar mais difícil o pensamento e estratégia que o jogador devera usar em seus pulos.

Mas Boson X é um jogo que será sempre de móbile,a ideai de trazer ele na Steam é boa e o jogo não é ruim,porem seu reino prevalecera com os jogos runners no móbile.

Nota:7/10

17978853.review:
*edit* I changed this review to a thumbs up because it's so addictive, I can't stop playing. While there are definitely still annoyances which sometimes screws up your game (like getting to 98% on a really hard level only to have the game screw you over by giving you not possible place to land *shakes fist*) it is still really fun, and aren't games supposed to be fun? Plus I believe it has taught me anger management skills. You can't play a frustratingly difficult game if you've put your foot through your monitor.*

This review is not negative by any means, it's more neutral than anything. Why? It's a good game with fun concepts, and while it's supposed to be difficult, the way in which they implemented this difficulty was pretty poor. 

[list]
    [*]You need to make decisions, often at the last minute as the track is being built right before your eyes. This can be tedious because, well, most people don't have the ability to see into the future?...
    [*]The point of each level is to go faster, which means landing on the bright blue track pieces. This would be fine if it weren't for the fact you are often punished for going too fast: You land on a blue track, go fast, try and jump onto the next bit and find you went too fast and just jumped into the abyss.
    [*]The track building is generally REALLY slow if you're going fast. HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO KNOW WHERE TO GO IF I CAN'T SEE ANYTHING???...??/>/?,SLKNFGKLM
[*]The music kind of sucks. This is just my taste though.
[/list]
It's definitely not a bad game, it could just do with some tweaking. I love playing frustratingly difficult games, but usually in ones that are done [i]right[/i] I die because I did something stupid, not because the game can't keep up with its own mechanics.

Overall score: 5/10 - fun but annoying.

17956396.review:
[h1]"В жизни надо всё попробовать". "Всё" — обычно наркотики, гомосексуализм и съёмки в порно. Гораздо реже — ядерная физика, альпинизм и шахматы.[/h1]

BOSON X - бесконечный невыносимо сложный 3D раннер. Некая смесь AudioSurf и Speedx 3D.

Весь геймлпей заключается в двух кнопках. Одной вы перепрыгиваете на дорожку слева, другой на дорожку справа, зажав обе кнопки прыгаете прямо. Тем не менее, такое простое управление не позволит расслабится вашим глазам. Время прохождения одной миссии, по большей части зависит от вашей реакции и опытности.

Игра не включает в себе сюжета, есть сеттинг, и заключается он в следующем: действия происходят в лаборатории, где трое (профессорша, директор и робот-ассистент), бегут в поисках бозона Х по собственным же экспериментальным трекам, попутно собирая энергию. В прочим всего мы имеем 18 непохожих друг на друга треков, разной сложности.

Пройти каждый уровень можно одним способом - собрать 100% энергии за один забег. Впрочем, если вы вдруг погибните, то количество энергии обнуляется, а вы продолжите бежать с рандомного места на треке. Честно говоря, даже на первых уровнях собрать чуть больше 100% энергии с первых десяти раз, точно не получится, ну а как только вы наберете заветные 100%, игра ускоряется примерно в два раза, что делает трек еще более хардкорным.

Игра хоть и казуальная, но предназначена явно для олдскул профи геймеров и любителей хардкора. Именно для них предусмотрена таблица лидеров. Вспоминая другие игры, тут она создана красиво и очень к месту. У кого железные нервы и много свободного времени, welcome! Игра сильно затягивает и с трудом отпускает тебя своей простотой и невыносимой сложностью!
