[h1]Беги, Форест, беги![/h1]

Механика прыжков поначалу заставляет начинать уровень заново примерно раз в десять секунд, но позже слегка привыкаешь. Только вот все увеличивающаяся скорость, в отличие от похожего чем-то проекта The Collider, не проверяет в полной мере ваши рефлексы - потому что в любом случае что-нибудь не рассчитаешь и начнешь продолжительный полет в пропасть или столкнешься с платформой, на которую прыгал, и начнешь сначала...
Геймплей платформенный - ты бежишь вперед, прыгаешь, и снова бежишь. Место "звездочек" или "монеток" занимают подсвеченные синим платформы - чем больше проведешь на ней времени, тем быстрее завершишь уровень, набрав 100%. Конечно, просто стопроцентный результат - это скучно, поэтому после достижения этой планки скорость резко увеличивается раз в ...дцать, и уровень продолжается с теми же условиями - набирай проценты на платформах пока не свалишься в пропасть, а потом смотри на свое место в таблице рекордов, соображая, каким же надо быть, чтобы заработать over900%, раз твое место с результатом в 340% - 3967?

17934282.review:
After playing about a good 4 hours of the game I think its fair to say I can fairly review this game.

First of all the pros and cons.

Pros:
+Nice art style.
+Decent soundtrack.
+Simple yet tight controls.
+It can get difficult.
+Gameplay is addictive as fuck.
+Scoreboard System works well.

Cons:
-The harder levels have shit flashing all over, which is distracting and may cause problems for epileptics.
-The soundtrack can eventually get boring and maybe even irritating due to it's short time and repetitiveness.
-It can get difficult.

Now, onto the actual review.

The game is basically an endless-runner with 3 characters to chose from. The aim of the game is to run and jump left and right along a brightly coloured and long hexagonal tube, while trying to run along blue flashing tiles until your velocity (or whatever it's called) reaches 100%. After reaching 100% you keep running until you die and then unlock the next level.

That is basically how the whole game plays out. My description may sound underwhelming, but honestly it is a great game. I paid 19p for it on sale (about 29 cents/0.29 usd) and I honestly would pay the full amount of £2 (3.05 usd) because it honestly worth it.

Do yourself a favour and bless your game library with this endless-running gem.

Final score: 7~8/10

[h1]Boson X est un jeu de fuite où vous devez avoir de bons réflexes[/h1]

Si j’ai bien compris, un scientifique parmi plusieurs au choix court dans un accélérateur de particules. Il doit éviter les différents vides ou les différents obstacles pour aller le plus loin possible.

J’appelle ce genre de jeu un « jeu de fuite » et les anglais l’appellent un « runner game ».

Même si je suis nul dans ce style de jeu (voyez la vidéo pour en être sur et ne vous moquez pas trop), je le trouve plutôt bien fait.

Par contre, j’aimerai bien que l’auteur rajoute plus de personnages, plus de parcours, plus de facteurs, ... bref, qu’il enrichisse ce jeu et le passe de petit jeu à jeu.

Aujourd’hui, le jeu est en ultra solde avec -90% sur le prix, résultat, il est à moins de 30 centimes d’euros, n’attendez pas, ne réfléchissez pas et achetez le maintenant !

No really. Hard as shit. So hard I gave up, while my girlfriend's at several HOURS on it, just to beat my high score.

It's not worth more than a couple bucks in my opinion, and you're not going to spend tens of hours on it, unless you're a crazy game junkie like my girlfriend. So buy it: sure, it's awesome. But dont' expect much from it, or you'll be disappointed.

17820451.review:
I'm a bit torn on this one - it's a perfectly decent 'endless runner' (actually not quite endless but you know what I mean) but the control system lets-it-down a bit.

The thing games like this is you should be making last-second decisions and JUST making it (or not) - but the control method here is "make a jump direction choice - live with it" - which means there's a time gap between hitting a button, realising it's the wrong-one - dying and there's nothing you can do about it.

Furthermore, the need to plan-ahead works with the speed of the levels/draw-in of the platforms to sometimes make the game outright unfair - in some cases you'll have to 'guess' or 'take a chance' because you can't see the thing you need to make a decision to jump towards (or at least the thing after it which is a dead-end or whatever). It's not HORRIBLY unfair - but it can be.

Admitedly that's in the tougher levels but the game doesn't mess about - the first level is fairly easy and then it gets a LOT harder!

End of the day I'm erring towards 'Not Recommended' simply because I think it lacks that "ahhhhh,,, yes!" or "ohhhh - no!!!!!!" factor which I tend to want in my twitch games - I don't like having time to realise I've made a mistake before it actually happens ;0

YMMV however - it's a competent game, just maybe lacking a bit of excitement and having a bit too much "unfair!"

17451009.review:
Patience, réactivité, concentration... vous en aurez fortement besoin pour venir à bout de ce platformer diaboliquement corsé et de son ambiance pour le moins psychédélique.
Le principe du jeu est très facile à comprendre: sauter de plateforme en plateforme, soit vers l'avant, soit sur les côtés, et gagner en charge via les plateformes cyan. Dans les premiers niveaux, la tâche semble aisée, mais au fur et à mesure, les obstacles deviennent difficiles à négocier. Et on se retrouve à passer beaucoup d'essais ratés pour étudier les niveaux, savoir à quel moment sauter, doser ses sauts, pour arriver à battre son record de quelques pourcents... Telle est la dure loi de ce jeu.

Si par contre vous êtes habitués aux défis vidéoludiques façon Super Hexagon, n'hésitez pas à l'acquérir. Néanmoins, même les joueurs moins aguerris pourront trouver leur compte, vu son prix vraiment abordable (voire quasiment donné pendant les soldes!).

17247270.review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Раннер оп третьего лица в котором мы играем за одного из трех персонажей (ученый мужик, ученая женщина и робот) которые участвуют в своих же собственных эксперементах путешествуя по квантовому ускорителю. Весь геймплей сводится к тому, что мы, прыгая с плитки на плитку должны набрать на специальных зеленых плитках 100% энергии, при этом упав в пропасть мы начинаем уровень сначала и все это на бешеной скорости.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ 18 уникальных и интересных уровней.
¥ Невероятный хардкор... Недостаточно сложно? Наберите 100% энергии и скорость перемещения увеличится еще в два раза.
¥ Глобальный рейтинг обычно в играх для галочки, но тут выполнив уровень действительно приятно красоваться в таблице среди таких же бегунов.
¥ Геймплей и управление заслуживают отдельного плюсика. Буквально миллисекунда держания кнопки полета и уже меняется весь расклад полета)

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Нет сюжета.
¥ Нет русского языка (уж меню и немного текста перевести могли - ради уважения трети пользователей стима)
¥ Плохо анимированные персонажи (комфортно играть мне было только мужиком, да и тот кривовато прыгал)
¥ Ужасная музыка. Под такой хардкор играет унылая музыка, будто мы в платформер какой нибудь-играем.

[h1]Достижения:[/h1]
¥ Все достижения получаются, просто пройдя каждый уровень на 100% энергии.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Проходил довольно долго... Пара уровней на 100% и затем длительный перерыв... Зайти и пройти сразу всю игру сможет только сумасшедший :) Но оно стоило того и я однозначно ее рекомендую любителям сложных игр.

[h1]Оценка: 7/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

17236269.review:
[B]Даже в существовании пыли больше смысла, чем в этой игре.[/B]

Казалось бы, бежать - это просто и увлекательно. Что в реальной жизни, что в виртуальной. Но эта игра ломает мироздание, ибо бежать здесь - уныло и быстро надоедает, а смакуя это с убогой системой генерации платформ (она не рандомная, нет - определенные алгоритмы на определенных уровнях свои и отличаются), которая иногда выдает безвыходные ситуации - даже отвратительно. 

Вся суть игры в беге и прыжках по платформам от третьего лица и ничего больше. Ничего больше нет. Ни объяснений для чего и почему, никаких других интересных эффектов, ничего. Все, что здесь меняется - обилие препятствий. Ах, ну да, мы же можем выбрать одного из трех персонажей! Только не думайте, что это светлое пятно: характеристики героев одинаковы.

Все осложняется психоделической электронной музыкой, которую ты сначала не замечаешь и даже думаешь, что она интересна, но после десятого повтора уровня (чекпоинтов нет, ахах - все до боли просто и примитивно!) невозможно под нее играть.

Зачем я купил это? Здесь нет ничего, абсолютно ничего, все ужасно глупо и бессмысленно. Жаль, что возвращать средства уже поздно... Что ж, хотя бы карточки есть.

Running inside of endless particle accelerator suspended in infinity, gaining speed until you make a new discovery... I'm not a physicist but I'm pretty sure that's how science is made.

It's a fast-paced runner game with simplistic yet appealing graphics, procedurally generated level design with unique feel and gimmicks in every level, and electronic soundtrack that fits in the game very well (though I'm not sure if it's good enough for listening by itself, but that's just not my kind of music in general)

It gets really cheap on sales, so give it a try, especially if you're into this kind of games.

Вроде бы всё просто, бегаешь себе, собираешь энергию.

С каждым уровнем абстракционизма добавляется всё больше и больше.
От небольших провалов в полу до вылетающих из неоткуда красно-синих платформ и переворачивающегося экрана.

Good idea, poor execution. By all means get it if you like running/reaction games, but wait for a sale.

I know this game is supposed to be difficult but a lot of the deaths feel like complete and total bull, and I wonder if the developers took the combination of various factors into account. Flashing platforms, being unable to see the edges of platforms, having difficulty seeing what's ahead of you and gradually escalating speed - any one of these on their own would be fine but combined together they result in a messy, irritating experience.

16730253.review:
I'm not usually a fan of this genre, but Boson X is very different. It starts out simple enough. The controls are pretty basic, the flow is very fluid and the game works perfectly. It's beautiful, the sound and music fit it flawlessly, and the gameplay is so damned addicting. Every time you think you hit a level you'll never beat after a lot of practice you end up thinking, "How could I have found that challenging?" And then the next level hits you with something new and the cycle begins again.
If you like the run and jump or platformer genres this is defintely worth hours of gameplay.

16680638.review:
Boson X is a fantastic game.  It's a little endless runner where you don't gain anything by progressing, you have to run on specific blue panels to gain score.  There are three buttons involved (jump left, jump right, and jump), and online leaderboards.  That's it.  No gimmicks.  No 'XP'.  No collectables.  Just you, three buttons, eighteen increasingly difficult levels, and a few thousand other people who are better than you at all of them.  Sure, the music is shit.  Sure, the graphics are nothing special.  Sure, the stages do start to get a bit artificially difficult towards the end (the Dark X Boson, where everything is in wireframe to make it deliberately difficult to tell what's going on is the worst offender here).

But Boson X is an absolute joy to play, and in my book, that's all that counts.

16401494.review:
[h1]BOSON X TL;DR[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Graphismes :[/b] Gros polygones et particules (rime avec cul...e). [b]Meh.[/b]
[*][b]Funomètre :[/b] Start. Game Over. Start. Game Over. Start. Game Over. x 100. [b]Meh.[/b]
[*][b]B.O. :[/b] Wub Wub Wub. [b]Meh.[/b]
[*][b]Scénario :[/b] C'est l'histoire d'un mec/d'une meuf/d'un robot qui court. [b]Meh.[/b]
[*][b]Bilan personnel :[/b] C'est génial !!! Mais un peu [b]Meh.[/b]

[*][b]Jeu à recommander ?[/b] Difficile à dire. A essayer d'abord. Donc, [b]Meh.[/b]
[/list]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LCcZqcPOlNM

[h1]Pourquoi que Boson X, je le trouve Meh., version longue ?[/h1]

Je disais donc, c'est l'histoire d'un personnage (un homme, une femme, un robot - vive l'égalité et la parité homme / femme / machine, elles aussi ont un coeur) que l'on regarde courir de derrière ([b]défilement automatique[/b]) et que l'on fait sauter droit devant, droit devant lui à gauche ou droit devant lui à droite (sur des polygones) pour qu'il évite obstacles (gros polygones) et trous (pas de polygone). 

En gros, on court dans un gros octogone sur l'ensemble des [b]18 niveaux[/b] (3 x 6) du jeu. Après qui, après quoi... Qui sait, que sais-je, que savons-nous, d'où venons-nous, où allons-nous ? On ne sait pas grand-chose, à part qu'il y a une base physico-particulo-mystique : nous sommes à la recherche du fameux Boson X, qu'il soit normal, dark ou anti, avec de cholies images de collisions style CERN.

Bref, y a pas d'histoire. Tu cours vers ta perte, point.

Mais comment qu'on gagne là-dedans ? Réponse : en courant sur des [b]polygones bleu clignotant[/b], on fait grimper une jauge. En atteignant 100%, on gagne le niveau (les couleurs changent et on peut continuer pour faire péter le record mondial de roxxor / maîtrise des polygones). En contrepartie, plus on se rapproche du 100%, plus on court vite et plus on risque de se manger la che-tron dans un mur.

Histoire simpliste, commandes très peu nombreuses, grande vitesse... Ces signes ne trompent pas : c'est soit un jeu de course automobile d'arcade (style NFS) ou un [b]DIE & RETRY[/b]. Boson X fait partie de la deuxième catégorie.

Du die & retry, vous allez en ch*er par paquet de 100, la vitesse de base étant déjà bien rapide, mais en plus, la génération des niveaux change pour chacun d'entre eux et ils sont tous plus psychédéliques les uns que les autres.

Bien heureusement, le retry après une mort est ultra-rapide (un bouton, pas de chargement) et la progression est évidente (quoique pouvant être assez longue à venir) : [b]chaque niveau possède un certain nombre de schémas / séquence d'obstacles que l'on apprend à éviter de mieux en mieux, jusqu'à vivre assez longtemps pour avoir le graal des 100%.[/b]
Du coup, c'est plutôt les premiers niveaux du jeu qui sont difficiles, le temps de prendre le pli. On trouve le 2e et 3e "mondes" un peu moins durs.

Mais qu'est-ce que j'ai pu rager sur certains niveaux ! Te rendre compte après 100 essais que tu n'arrives toujours pas à dépasser 20% régulièrement, ça peut décourager...

C'est pourquoi [b]je recommande surtout de l'essayer avant achat.[/b] Votre propre funomètre dépendra de votre skill et de votre endurance au game over.

Enfin, la bande son donne la pêche sur certains morceaux, mais reste uniquement composée de wub wub wub. Ca colle bien au style du gameplay, mais ça a tendance à coller au crâne aussi. Wub wub wub.

Et les succès : vous aurez un 100% de succès garanti après la fin du jeu (1 succès par niveau terminé). Donc c'est cool.


[h1]Le mot de la fin de Obabamama[/h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFAyb69_mKs

Thank you, Ma'am.

16376888.review:
The best part about this game is that it scales really, really well. In this way it allows you to learn the jump patterns over time. So even if you can't complete a level initially if you keep at it chances are you'll recognize a pattern and eventually overcome it. The routes you have to run are varied and new obstacles are added at every point in the game which makes gameplay fun. The controls are simple (arrow keys) and easy to use as well.
 
The soundtrack is good. It is upbeat and fits with the art style which is also interesting and intuitive. The way the score is displayed is fantastic and fits well with the particle physics theme. 

The one bad thing I have to say about this game is that there is a lot of flashing lights and the visual style is very hard on the eyes. This makes it hard to play for more than an hour or so at a time. 

If you enjoy platform jumpers you'll enjoy this game.

16312375.review:
All the reviews I can find on Steam seem positive for this game, which is clearly marketing bias.  I'm an avid gamer and I like difficult games, and indie games, and this type of design.  But this game is atrocious.  I can't be the only one who thinks so? 

This game is a hipster-hype nightmare.  The gameplay the boring "test your reaction time" type, OK, fine.  I'm already not that enticed but whatever.  I gave it a good few plays, on multiple occasions, and I wanted to love it.  Then I just wanted to LIKE it.  But it's one of those games that has some tricky mechanic which seems unfair - in Boson X's case, you jump platforms - but the thing is, after a level or two platforms start randomly dropping off.  But there isn't any indication of when this happens, at least that I could tell, and it is just too hard to determine your vertical position - there isn't any ground or reference area to be able to tell if the platform is dropping - it starts to drop, you jump, but you're too low to make the next platform, and the game says Ooopsoe!  Try again!  But.... it doesn't feel like my fault, like I could even do anything about those deaths.

So the end effect is that I start the game, play an easy level, think "ooo, I may like this". Next level, I'll jump to a platform and be too low to land it.... but.... what?  I didn't even know I was dropping.  So I try the tutorial, which is of the modern, very hipster, minimalist school of tutorials where it has to be self-righteous about its hyper simple core gameplay, emphasising how "clean" and "simple" the gameplay is.  But it doesn't even mention these dropping platforms!  How do I deal with them?  They seem unpredictable and random, and every time you die from being too low it seems really cheap to me.

I search online, and of course, you just hear people bragging about how amazing they are and how easy the game is etc..... I dunno.  For my money (and I did pay money for this game!), it's an overhyped game which treats its players with disrespect.  I love a game which punishes - but it has to feel fair.  This game feels like it throws me under a bus, and I didn't even know the bus was coming, and I didn't even see the bus until my face was plated firmly in the bumper.  I wish I could at least find info on how those falling platforms work, but all you can find is over-hype and people bragging about how awesome they are, or how amazing the game is, etc.  Honestly - overhyped, boring gameplay, and the design is too noisy and trendy/indie/bleh.  And this is coming from an indie games NERD.

16145361.review:
This is a very well-made endless-runner game by a couple of indie developers.

The basic idea is that your character represents a particle in a series of 3 particle accellerators, and you need to get your particle up to a certain energy level by standing on the blue platorms. If you hit anything head-on or fall down you have to start over again. As you get more and more power you start to move faster and faster. Once you get to 100% you can either collide with something to discover a new particle or you can continue on to get a high score for your power level.

That said, the game technically does have an official endpoint. The game is named "Boson X," and one of the "particles" you can discover is the X Boson, you could say that's a good spot to end off if you don't want to go for 100% completion.

All this is made more difficult by the fact that the levels range from easy to begin with to extremely unique and difficult in their own regards. An example of one of the levels: [spoiler]The X Boson level is actually rendered in wireframe, making a lot of it quite challenging.[/spoiler]

There is no real plot to the game, though the characters are quite cool. There's a man, a woman, and a robot. Personally, the robot (Keiro is its name) is my favorite to play as.

The controls are tight, responsive and easy to get used to. You only need 3 buttons: left, right, and up. Hold the buttons for longer, the longer you jump, and if you press a direction key you'll move a lane over in that direction. Different levels have different numbers of lanes too.

The graphics are quite nice, they're not complex but they're eye-catching and nicely stylized. There are no actual quality or graphics options though you have the option to lower or mute the audio, to play in fullscreen or windowed. The game is not very resource intensive at all, and you can run this at 60fps 1080p on fairly low-end hardware.

I also like to listen to my own music while playing it, which seems to improve my performance a bit, the soundtrack in the game isn't that great.

CONS:

PROS:

Final Remarks:
Even though I mastered the game, I kind of hated it.

. REPUDIATED .

15658359.review:
Set in a particle accelerator, in some sort of metaphor for the scientific method, you play either a scientist [male], scientist [female], or the better third gender - robot. It is a nice touch that they added the ability to pick your gender, but it doesn't really affect the gameplay beyond the footstep sound.

The game is what you could call 3D, however the main running is along the x axis, you jump on the y and instead of moving left/right to avoid obstacles or jump gaps, you 'rotate' around a predefined polygon. This was an interesting game mechanic, and I felt the game executed it very well.

The different levels generate randomly but each one has its own signature features, from platforms that move or drop out beneath you to the various structures that they make up. This is good, because it prevents you from just learning the tricks to the first level and burning right through the others.

The style is very minimalistic, and it manages to pull it off well. With the exception of one level and its 'wireframe' look [which is completely impossible to play, as far as i'm concerned], the various styles to levels work nicely. Some of the music is good, but overall it was OK. The world you run through doesn't require the music [i.e. it isn't generated according to the music], although it would be a nice addition if they made that so.

It can be played with either the keyboard or controller, and both work equally well for this game. I didn't have the game crash on me at all, and there were no installation problems. Some screen tearing, but that is easily solved.

Boson X is a very fast-paced runner game that seems in many ways similar to Super Hexagon. If you liked that and want to try a runner, then you should play this.

15606838.review:
[h1] Oh look, another rage game (it's fun though) [/h1]

Oh Boson X, how you anger me so. But seriously, this game is fun. 

Game mechanics: this is an endless runner where you press left to jump left, press right to jump right, and press up to jump forward. Hold these keys longer for longer jumps. Don't fall, or hit the platforms/walls.The context that they put this game is interesting: you're a physicist trying to discover new particles. Your objective is to land and run on blue platforms and increase your particle discovery to 100%. Red platforms fall (and try to screw you up). You can go over if you want, but that's just for a high score. When you hit 100%, you can discover new particles. Be careful, you go faster as you approach 100%, with a significant boost in speed after hitting that percentage. Each level has certain repeating units of platforms, which allows for a learning curve. 

This game can get hard quickly, but as I said before, there is some predictibility with platform within the levels, so you can learn the layout and get closer and closer to 100%. The satisfaction and exciting gameplay is the reward that overshadows the sometimes big frustration.
 
It is a simple game, so there is not much to criticize. Perhaps, longer music loops for the levels (it can get quite annoying).

Buy it now; it's price, whether full or discounted, is cheap.

I'd like to start off by saying... THIS GAME IS TERRIBLE AND STUPID AND FRUSTRATING AND TERRIBLE. 

Okay, now that's out of the way, I must say this game is amazing. It will make you want to punch someone on occasion, but that's okay. When you realize that there's only 18 levels, you might think that the game will be beaten in 10 minutes, but nooooooooo. Even after 80 tries, I still haven't beaten one of the first levels. This game is so addicting and simple, that you need to buy it NOW. Especially when it's on sale like I did. Best 74 cents I've ever spent. But seriously, as much as I love this game, and as many times that I laugh at Keiro's ingenious design, there are a few flaws. But they're just a few gameplay bugs that (hopefully) can easily be fixed. Every once in a while a jump won't register, or it will register, but for whatever reason you fall. I know I sound like a really crabby person saying that, but in this game, every millisecond counts.

Other than that though, this game is awesome 9/10

15269465.review:
Бессмысленный runner, во всех смыслах...
В-первую очередь брал из-за высоких оценок пользователей, во-вторую уже из-за карточек и того что стоит копейки. Не отпугнуло ни бедность в визуальном исполнении, ни ощущение очередного порта с мобильных платформ выполненного на отъебись, ни то что игра изначально вообще была бесплатной.. Вся надежда была на геймплей, а как раз с ним и возникли вопросы:
вообще я не любитель прям хардкорных игр, но чувство челенджа люблю, нравится видеть сложный уровень, и оxуевая от трудности проходить его, стремясь к поставленной цели, но это про какую-то другую, хорошую хардкорную игру, не про эту... Здесь же игровая механика предлагает бесконечный забег по какому-то "тоннелю" по выстроенным секциям из разных блоков с перепадами высоты и со своими правилами. Ключевое слово здесь - бесконечный. В принципе у меня возникло бы гораздо меньше претензий, если бы геймдизайнерам хватило мозгов придумать несколько десятков уровней, где ты стремишься к концу уровня, пускай и через те же рандомно строящиеся секции блоков. Но вместо этого мы должны вылавливать из общего потока синие блоки, которые нас ускоряют и когда ускорение дойдет до 100% - мы победили. Вроде пока не страшно, но что же дальше?
А дальше проблемы сразу с нескольких сторон: возможность управления персонажем ограничена тремя действиями(прыжок влево, прыжок вправо, и просто прыжок, длительность нажатия влияет на длительность прыжка), если бы механика позволяла совершать двойные прыжки (или любые другие плюшки позволяющие больше полагаться на реакцию и уходить от препятствий), но нет, обязательно должна быть платформа от которой нужно оттолкнутся, а в воздухе мы уже ничего сделать не можем из-за "разнообразности" все той же игровой механики, и если первые пару уровней еще ничего, то дальше нас начинают загонять в плотные тоннели из блоков(где мы не видим дальнейший уровень) или начинают строить секции блоков прямо у игрока под ногами, и причем все это не в середине игры, а уже начиная с третьего уровня. Что, учитывая выше описанные ограничения с управлением и приводит к главным проблемам: вот ты бежишь по уровню, секция выстраивается впереди тебя буквально в 4-5 блоках, прыгаешь строго ориентируясь на ближайшие блоки, и вот впереди пустота, секция блоков еще не появилась, а тебе уже пора прыгать, потому что твой блок заканчивается, и вот ты прыгаешь "на удачу", вися до последнего в воздухе, надеясь что ты выбрал правильное направление и на твоем пути появится блок. Конечно это легче сделать когда ты уже проходил уровень, и примерно представляешь что будет дальше, даже не видя этого в текущий момент.
Но а так шансы пройти уровень с первой попытки практически нулевые, и это смогут сделать только очень удачливые игроки, в противном случае вы должны сперва пробежать уровень несколько десятков раз, что бы уже просто запоминая структуру уровня - угадывать появляющиеся впереди секции, и проходить, а точнее задрoтить так все уровни до конца игры.

Я за хардкорность, но тогда когда она справедлива и лаконична, а не обусловлена тупым геймдизайном, ограниченным во всех смыслах управлением, кривой игровой механикой, где полагаться в первую очередь приходится не на собственное чувство реакции(хотя и оно должно быть), а на удачу и задрoтсво

I downloaded the demo weeks ago and found myself constantly replaying the 6 levels availible for hours.So when i picked up the full game i was spoiled with even more levels to play. This platformer's unique  art style is great as the geometry looks simple but is far from it. As the game progresses the levels get faster,more detailed and more complicated. My mind was never at ease YET it was relaxing to constantly die, death after death, and continue playing. (The menu is nice and quick if you are easily frustrated and need to rage quit quick. I did this constantly but i kept re-opening the game because it was to addictive to stop.) The soundtrack complements the game well with it dynamically changing to the levels style. 

Should you buy this game? Yes.
 I got incredibly lucky and got it on sale for just 75 cents.... 75 cents for a game you spend hours on, with great replayability, especially because of its competitve leaderboards. Its Normal price is 3 euro but even then, its a bargain. If the game devolpers objective was to create a simple,classic and fun platforming game, it has done its job rather well.
~4/5

いわゆるエンドレスランナー系のゲーム。

PVを見て面白そうだと思い自分の中でハードルが上がっていたのか、実際プレイしてみると思いの外動作がもっさりとしていてストレスが溜まりました。
この手のゲームはプレイしているうちに操作に慣れてステージをクリアできるようになると達成感や面白さを感じるようになると思うのですが、ギリギリで降りているつもりが届いていない等の感覚と操作の不一致を感じたままでもクリア出来てしまい達成感は得られませんでした。
しっくりこないと思いながらも4ステージクリアし、Y Bosonのステージをプレイし真っ黒い背景に赤い点滅する板だけが出る場所で「目が疲れるしストレスが溜まるだけだ」と感じてしまいやめました。
青い板を踏むことで加速していくのですが(踏むことで%が増加し100%を超えるとクリア)わりと青い板が来ない状態で走らされる時間が長く、動作だけでなくゲームの進行ももっさりしていると言いますかスピード感がないように感じてしまいました。
このゲームをプレイする前に某箱を6つ集めてレベルを上げるゲームをずっとプレイしていたのもスピード感がないと感じた一因かもしれません。

購入しようと思っている方はPVだけでなくプレイ動画も見てみることをおすすめします。
PVで感じるよりもサクサクはしていないと思います。
ユーザーレビューが非常に好評になっているので、多くの人が求めるスピード感はあるのかもしれません。ですが自分には合わなかったのでどうしてもおすすめはできません。

A very simple platformer, both visually and gameplay-wise, with levels getting more complex as you unlock them.

14287152.review:
I'm hesitant to call this game casual because of how much time I spend screaming while playing it, but it's a good game to load up and play for a few minutes at a time. Much more than that can start giving you a headache. The game looks like a dream you would have if you fell asleep in a high-level physics class. When I first found it I was reminded a lot of Super Hexagon, but I prefer Boson X beacuse while both games are about timing and pattern recognition, in Boson X there are more ways to accomplish the same goal and a bit more oppurtunity for recovery if things don't go exactly as planned. The soundtrack is repetitive so I reccomend muting the sound and turning on your own music. 

My partner is red/green colorblind and has a hard time identifying which platforms are energy, given that each level uses different colors and the colors invert after beating the level. But to all of you spectrally challenged gamers out there the pulsing pattern of the energy platforms versus the "will-collapse" platforms is different, so if you pay attention to that you should be good. 

All in all I would reccomend this game. Some might find this game unnecessarily frustrating, but for people like me who need to go to flying shape pulsing color platform hell sometimes, it's definitely worth the price.

14114518.review:
Boson X is a 3D endless-runner. You have to go through 18 levels (3 worlds, 6 levels in each) with 3 different characters (only for the skin, you do not have different skills). In order to win, you have to discover particles by running and jumping (left, ahead or right) on blue tiles and reach 100%. The more you stay on a blue tile, the faster you increase your %. It does not matter how long it takes you, as long as you stay alive and reach 100% without dying.

About dying, it is going to happen a lot : you have to die again and again to get better and finally complete a level. Do not be afraid, this is how this game works. You will get an achievement for each completed level, but the difficulty is increasing after each level, and it becomes quite challenging quickly (I must confess that this is my first endless-runner).

To conclude, this is a pretty good and fun game, plus a challenging one ! If you like this kind of game, do not hesitate, at the current price (2,99€), you should buy it :)

13996246.review:
ストーリー的な物は特になく、ランダム生成された通路をおじさんおばさんが驚異的な速度でダッシュしたりジャンプするゲーム。

操作はシンプルで、矢印キーを右に押せば1マス右に、左を押せば1マス左に移動するとともにジャンプ。上を押せばそのままジャンプする。
押している長さで飛距離が変わるので、タイミングを見極める必要がある。
ランダムとは言えステージごとに生成される通路はパターンが決まっているので、ある程度プレイすれば把握する事自体は難しくないが、段々先読みしないと追いつかなくなってくる。難易度は高め。
ただ、絶対これ無理だろう、と思えるパターンは無かったので、あまり理不尽さは感じなかった。
ランダムで出る速度の上昇するポイントを進むことで、100%まで上げると次のステージが解放されるが、そのときに演出が入るおかげで死にやすいのがちょっと気になった程度。

実績に関してもシンプルで、全部ステージの%を100%以上にする物しかないのでわかりやすい。
難易度高めなゲームがしたいな、という人におすすめ。

No driving simulator will ever teach you to keep your eyes on the road quite like this. An extremely difficult and frustrating game but the sort where failures are always your fault and never the game just being cheap, more the sort to hunch over the keyboard, learn every possible combination of sections and mash the arrow keys until your eyes start bleeding. 

The music can get repetitive, despite its quality, as you will be attempting certain levels several times, not helped by the fact that there are seemingly only six tracks between eighteen levels. Perhaps two possible songs per level that are randomised could help with the minor monotony of it all.

It's not the sort of game to be played for hours at a time. It's the thing you play for maybe twenty minutes until your brain can't handle it any more and it's certainly worth the asking price.

12951122.review:
This game does not forgive as it says in the game description - if you misstep a platform a little too early or late, you lose. If you do not have the effort and determination/drive in order to complete a level, you lose. If you do not have excellent reflexes, you lose. You may be thinking as you read this: why should I play this game? Why should I buy a game for £1.99 on Steam when it is this hard? There are many games on this online gaming platform that are expensive (like Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare, for example) and make you buy map packs/DLC in order to get the most out of the game. This game does not have DLC, or map packs, or even in-game purchases - all of this is built into the game for a fair one-time price of £1.99. This game does not even need DLC, for I can assure you that this game is like an orange: you can squeeze as much out of it as you want. There is no limit to how much fun you can get out of this game (or rather, tears :3) because it takes time to complete the levels of this game, and a lot of it. You can complete the first level and leave the game in your Steam library, unplayed, forever if you like, or you can decide to dedicate time and effort to completing every single level and beating the game, as well as getting a lot out of it. I have already completed this game, and will continue to rise up the leaderboards on this game until I have got the most out of it than I can, and you can too, for a measly price of £1.99. 

In conclusion, buy this game now and never regret it. :D 10/10

12756204.review:
Boson X provides a simple and clean endless runner experience with a mixture of randomization. While the characters that you chose only make a difference visually, the game attempts and succeeds in providing a unique set of levels that you will definitely find challenging without some practice. The controls are simple yet may feel difficult if you try to jump like a traditional platformer would.

The only reason I picked up Boson X was to complete the achievements and try out something that I usually do not play. I'm one of those observers that looks at the running genre and wants to run with it but ends up saying no because of price, mechanics, or fear that the product will fall short of my expectations. Boson X  not only met my expectations but blew my mind with some of the crazy levels that were thrown at me.

The objective of the game is very simple: keep on the platforms and try to run on the blue ones. While there are several hazards to look out for, that is the essence of the game. Running on blue platforms will get you closer to completing the level and make you run faster and faster building up tension and excitement when your beat your highscore. Leaderboards are offered and can be fun to push yourself further up the leaderboards after you have completed a level. 

The level variety and difficulty is reasonable and able to be mastered to a certain extent. Randomization helps break up monotony and adds to the mystery of what your going to run through next. Levels that I thought were impossible were beatable in a few days of learning the level (and a lot of failing).

During my time of playing Boson X, I have not found any game breaking bugs... or actually any bugs at all.  I can confirm that it works on the Xbox 360 controller as advertised. The game performed exceptionally well and had options to play in window and fullscreen modes. This was especially useful as I was able to practice and play Boson X while watching Youtube or Twitch.

I highly recommend this for anyone who think they might be into runners.

12285127.review:
Boson X is a minimalistic runner with very simple gameplay. However, that's all it needs; the execution is almost flawless and the game is very fun, challenging, and addicting.

Boson X is based around one main mechanic that involves rotating the world as you jump, allowing you to leap to either side of you or straight ahead. By running on glowing blue platforms, your score (and speed) will increase; victory is achieved by scoring 100%. As mentioned above, while the premise is very simple, each level is distinctly different from one another and some even include special hazards.

$3 gives you 18 levels with huge replay value. The price is exceptional for what the game offers, but if you aren't convinced, there is a free version on the [url=http://www.boson-x.com/]game's website[/url]with 6 levels (and one less character skin).

Overall, Boson X is a great game and I definitely recommend it.

12222022.review:
A lot of this game is based around skill, and another large part of this game is based around getting lucky, and yet another large part of this game is about memorizing the patterns. I'd prefer if it focused more on the skill and less on memorization and luck.

This game feels a bit held back due to the fact that your character is a human running in some particle accelerator(?) because they never feel responsive enough to deal with some of what the game likes to throw at you.

Also, mild seizure warning. It isn't bad really, but there was one level where the screen was blank at times except for a bunch of blinking paths. I'm not sensitive but I could see where someone who is might not like it too much.

All of that said, if you like this genre, then you will probably like this game. If you DON'T like runners, then probably not. I recommend it because I think it is a good runner for those that like runners even through my criticisms. It helps that it is really cheap.

12209359.review:
Great game for the price.

Good:
- Fast, so fast
- Easy to tell what platforms will do
- Very challenging

Bad:
- The random map generation uses specific sequences and patches them all together, so it's not random.  That's not bad, but a lot of the sequences are designed in such a way that there's absolutely no way you can know what's about to appear unless you've run through it before.
- Buttons sometimes register at the wrong time
- The control scheme of pressing L/R to jump left/right and then holding it to stay up while you move forward is very confusing and takes a lot of getting used to.
- Each level has a gimmick in the way that it spawns in the new platforms, and sometimes that gimmick makes it unduely difficult to tell where a platform actually is
- The sequences are clearly designed with low speed in mind, so as you gain speed more and more of them will become impossible.  Most of this only happens after you've reached 100% and completed the level, but there's a couple in a couple levels that will end your game before you reach 100%.

As a fan of runners I was able to overlook the bad and have a decent amount of fun with it.  It's dirt cheap, too, so I'm going to recommend it.

7/10 - It's fun but poor controls and map design hold it back.

12203390.review:
Difficult as fekk; check. Addictive; double check. 

Man, this game. If you like "runner" games, this is the title for you - and it's so cheap too! You only use three buttons, controlling which way and how far you jump. Each level has its own style and difficulty. The latter increasing for each level, until it's so difficult you have nothing but a big grin on your face when you finally beat it. 

It can be a bit too hard at times if you aren't familiar with the genre, but you'll get the hang of it, and the time it takes to master it is definitely worth it. The only "con" to this game is the damn music, which gets stuck in your head for a really long time afterwards.

All in all, this is a game I would reccommend for pretty much everyone. It's small in its premise, but generates hours of fun (and rage).

[table][tr][th][h1][b]FR[/b][/h1][/th][th][h1][u]Premières impressions[/u] : [/h1][/th][th]v. 0 -[/th][/tr][/table]
Boson X est un Endless Runner génial, visuellement très cohérent et agréable tout en restant ardu. 

La difficulté provient des sauts que vous devez exécuter. Ils doivent être savamment dosés, une fois lancé plus de corrections possibles : ni gauche, ni droite, ni augmentation de la hauteur. Vous n'avez plus que le pouvoir de l'arrêter au bon moment. 

Les essais successifs s'enchaînent très vite après un échec, ça en devient addictif. Par ailleurs, si les niveaux sont construits aléatoirement, certaines structures précises se répètent, limitant la frustration et autorisant un certain apprentissage. 

Interface, musique, enchaînement entre les niveaux, tout me rappelle beaucoup Supherexagon. Trois personnages différents, la variation entre niveaux est plutôt dynamique ce qui limite très bien l'effet de répétition. 

C'est mon préféré dans le genre.

12136833.review:
Since times before the personal computer, arcade and arcade-like games have been liked and played by a majority of gamers, even in the futuristic year of 2014. And among these types of games, there are the runners, the one where you have to "simply" dodge and jump on and over hazards and other objects. However, Boson X takes that principle to an entirely different level.

The goal of Boson X is to run and jump from platform to platform on a 3D field, and filling up your meter by running on the (glowing) blue platforms. When this meter reaches 100%, you'll "discover a new element" and finish the level, but you can keep going to increase this meter even more at a higher speed, which will make you look better on the online score boards.

Your character can jump forward, or jump to either the left path next to them, or the right. You cannot change your path mid-jump, and you can hold down the key to increase your jump height. The controls might sound simple, and they are in theory, but you'll have to use these three commands to their fullest potential if you want a chance at beating all 18 levels.

Boson X is what people may call a "Super Hexagon on foot", most likely because the game has a hexagon field, and you have to dodge empty spaces and walls. Though not exactly true, they both share a similarity: They're both incredibly difficult. Boson X will test your reaction time to new lengths as you progress through the game, adding in different types of platforms, appearing in different ways and speeds. Though each level has a certain pattern, the way these patterns emerge are in parts and randomized, so memorizing them won't do you much good if you don't have the reaction speed to match it.

For 3$/3€, Boson X is well worth your money, with levels that will make you want to pull your hair out, incredibly smooth gameplay, and if you're dedicated enough, you'll put plenty of hours into it. Just make sure you've got the patience for it, otherwise your monitor will be on the other side of your room by the time you've failed the same level a hundred times.

And trust me, you will.

12110725.review:
If you like the "runner" genre you'll love this one.

You're basically running through an endless tubular map and you jump to either side or straight up and you can jump higher by holding the button/direction pressed. You cannot move more than 1 tile to the sideways without landing first though.

The goal is to get as much energy as possible by running on the blue tiles while avoiding any collisions or bottomless pits. Once you reach 100% of energy you're free to collide against something or fall to end a stage, otherwise you can keep going and try to reach a higher score.

* Simple graphics, which means it can run on any toaster and wont bother you while going at full speed.

* Good soundtrack! It's kinda electronic-something, I don't know, it sounds good enough in game and it changes dynamically (The more upbeat version plays when you reach over 100% of energy).

* Controls are quite comfortable. You can just plug in your Xbox 360 controller and be ready to play. You can move with the triggers, the shoulder buttons, the directional pad and the analog, they're all supported at the same time.

* Excellent port of what I suppose is an iOS game. No flaws in framerate nor stuttering or anything.

* Achievements aren't something so special here, they're all about you beating a stage. Latter stages are quite hard though! Still, it would've been cool to have some weird achievements or even some score attack ones to push you to try harder.

* Good replayability if you care about score attack and leaderboards.

I'm sure the graphics are WAY too simple for a lot of people but the game is just 3 dollars full price. I don't really mind that. I had lots of fun so far and I expect to 100% the game in a few days.
